sentences.zh: 楚之先祖出自帝顓頊高陽。

translations.literal: Chu's first ancestors came from Emperor Zhuan Xu Gao Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Chu's first ancestors came from Emperor Zhuan Xu Gao Yang.

sentences.zh: 高陽者，黃帝之孫，昌意之子也。

translations.literal: Gao Yang was Yellow Emperor's grandson, Chang Yi's son.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Yang was the Yellow Emperor's grandson and Chang Yi's son.

sentences.zh: 高陽生稱，稱生卷章，卷章生重黎。

translations.literal: Gao Yang begot Cheng. Cheng begot Juan Zhang. Juan Zhang begot Chong Li.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Yang begot a son named Cheng, who begot Juan Zhang, who in turn begot Chong Li.

sentences.zh: 重黎為帝嚳高辛居火正，甚有功，能光融天下，帝嚳命曰祝融。

translations.literal: Chong Li served Emperor Ku Gao Xin as fire official. He had great merit and could illuminate and unite the world. Emperor Ku named him Zhu Rong.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Li served Emperor Ku Gao Xin as the fire official. He had great merit and could illuminate and unite the world. Emperor Ku named him Zhu Rong.

sentences.zh: 共工氏作亂，帝嚳使重黎誅之而不盡。

translations.literal: The Gong Gong clan made rebellion. Emperor Ku sent Chong Li to execute them but he did not complete it.
translations.idiomatic: The Gong Gong clan made rebellion. Emperor Ku sent Chong Li to execute them, but he did not complete it.

sentences.zh: 帝乃以庚寅日誅重黎，而以其弟吳回為重黎後，復居火正，為祝融。

translations.literal: The emperor then executed Chong Li on the Geng Yin day, and made his younger brother Wu Hui Chong Li's successor. He again served as fire official and became Zhu Rong.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor then executed Chong Li on the Geng Yin day, and made his younger brother Wu Hui Chong Li's successor. He again served as the fire official and became Zhu Rong.

sentences.zh: 吳回生陸終。

translations.literal: Wu Hui begot Lu Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Hui begot Lu Zhong.

sentences.zh: 陸終生子六人，坼剖而產焉。

translations.literal: Lu Zhong begot six sons. They were born by splitting open.
translations.idiomatic: Lu Zhong begot six sons. They were born by splitting open.

sentences.zh: 其長一曰昆吾；

translations.literal: His eldest named Kun Wu;
translations.idiomatic: His eldest was named Kun Wu;

sentences.zh: 二曰參胡；

translations.literal: Second named Shen Hu;
translations.idiomatic: The second was named Shen Hu;

sentences.zh: 三曰彭祖；

translations.literal: Third named Peng Zu;
translations.idiomatic: The third was named Peng Zu;

sentences.zh: 四曰會人；

translations.literal: Fourth named Hui Ren;
translations.idiomatic: The fourth was named Hui Ren;

sentences.zh: 五曰曹姓；

translations.literal: Fifth surnamed Cao;
translations.idiomatic: The fifth was surnamed Cao;

sentences.zh: 六曰季連，羋姓，楚其後也。

translations.literal: Sixth named Ji Lian, surnamed Mi. Chu were their descendants.
translations.idiomatic: The sixth was named Ji Lian, surnamed Mi. Chu were their descendants.

sentences.zh: 昆吾氏，夏之時嘗為侯伯，桀之時湯滅之。

translations.literal: The Kun Wu clan, in Xia times, once was a marquis elder. In Jie's time, Tang extinguished it.
translations.idiomatic: The Kun Wu clan, in Xia times, once was a marquis elder. In Jie's time, Tang extinguished it.

sentences.zh: 彭祖氏，殷之時嘗為侯伯，殷之末世滅彭祖氏。

translations.literal: The Peng Zu clan, in Yin times, once was a marquis elder. In Yin's last age, the Peng Zu clan was extinguished.
translations.idiomatic: The Peng Zu clan, in Yin times, once was a marquis elder. In Yin's last age, the Peng Zu clan was extinguished.

sentences.zh: 季連生附沮，附沮生穴熊。

translations.literal: Ji Lian begot Fu Ju. Fu Ju begot Xue Xiong.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Lian begot Fu Ju, who begot Xue Xiong.

sentences.zh: 其後中微，或在中國，或在蠻夷，弗能紀其世。

translations.literal: Their descendants declined in the middle period. Some were in the central states, some in the barbarian Yi. They could not record their generations.
translations.idiomatic: Their descendants declined in the middle period. Some were in the central states, some in the barbarian Yi. They could not record their generations.

sentences.zh: 周文王之時，季連之苗裔曰鬻熊。

translations.literal: Zhou Wen Wang time, Ji Lian's descendants named Yu Xiong.
translations.idiomatic: In King Wen of Zhou's time, Ji Lian's descendants included one named Yu Xiong.

sentences.zh: 鬻熊子事文王，蚤卒。

translations.literal: Yu Xiong died early.
translations.idiomatic: Yu Xiong served King Wen as a son, but died early.

sentences.zh: 其子曰熊麗。

translations.literal: His son was named Xiong Li.
translations.idiomatic: His son was named Xiong Li.

sentences.zh: 熊麗生熊狂，熊狂生熊繹。

translations.literal: Xiong Li begot Xiong Kuang. Xiong Kuang begot Xiong Yi.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Li begot Xiong Kuang, who begot Xiong Yi.

sentences.zh: 熊繹當周成王之時，舉文、武勤勞之後嗣，而封熊繹於楚蠻，封以子男之田，姓羋氏，居丹陽。

translations.literal: Xiong Yi, in Zhou Cheng Wang's time, was raised as Wen and Wu's diligent labor descendants, and Xiong Yi was enfeoffed in Chu barbarian lands. He was enfeoffed with zi and nan fields, surnamed Mi clan, and resided at Dan Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Yi, in King Cheng of Zhou's time, was raised as one of Wen and Wu's diligent labor descendants, and Xiong Yi was enfeoffed in the Chu barbarian lands. He was enfeoffed with zi and nan fields, surnamed the Mi clan, and resided at Dan Yang.

sentences.zh: 楚子熊繹與魯公伯禽、衛康叔子牟、晉侯燮、齊太公子呂伋俱事成王。

translations.literal: Chu zi Xiong Yi with Lu gong Bo Qin, Wei Kang Shu son Mu, Jin hou Xie, Qi eldest son Lü Ji all served Cheng Wang.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu lord Xiong Yi, together with the Lu lord Bo Qin, Wei Kang Shu's son Mu, the Jin lord Xie, and Qi's eldest son Lü Ji, all served King Cheng.

sentences.zh: 熊繹生熊艾，熊艾生熊亶，熊亶生熊勝。

translations.literal: Xiong Yi begot Xiong Ai. Xiong Ai begot Xiong Dan. Xiong Dan begot Xiong Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Yi begot a son named Xiong Ai, who begot Xiong Dan, who begot Xiong Sheng.

sentences.zh: 熊勝以弟熊楊為後。

translations.literal: Xiong Sheng made his younger brother Xiong Yang his successor.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Sheng made his younger brother Xiong Yang his successor.

sentences.zh: 熊楊生熊渠。

translations.literal: Xiong Yang begot Xiong Qu.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Yang begot Xiong Qu.

sentences.zh: 熊渠生子三年。

translations.literal: Xiong Qu begot three sons.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Qu begot three sons.

sentences.zh: 當周夷王之時，王室微，諸侯或不朝，相伐。

translations.literal: In Zhou Yi Wang's time, the wang chamber declined. Some feudal lords did not attend court and attacked each other.
translations.idiomatic: In King Yi of Zhou's time, the royal house declined. Some feudal lords did not attend court and attacked each other.

sentences.zh: 熊渠甚得江漢閒民和，乃興兵伐庸、楊蠆，至于鄂。

translations.literal: Xiong Qu greatly obtained harmony with the people between Jiang and Han, so he raised troops and attacked Yong and Yang Lao, reaching E.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Qu greatly obtained harmony with the people between the Jiang and Han rivers, so he raised troops and attacked Yong and Yang Lao, reaching E.

sentences.zh: 熊渠曰：「我蠻夷也，不與中國之號謚。」

translations.literal: Xiong Qu said: 'I barbarian Yi, not with central states titles posthumous names.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Qu said: 'I am a barbarian Yi, and I do not use the titles and posthumous names of the central states.'

sentences.zh: 乃立其長子康為句亶王，中子紅為鄂王，少子執疵為越章王，皆在江上楚蠻之地。

translations.literal: He then established his eldest son Kang as Gou Dan wang, middle son Hong as E wang, and youngest son Zhi Ci as Yue Zhang wang, all in the Chu barbarian lands on the Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: He then established his eldest son Kang as King of Gou Dan, his middle son Hong as King of E, and his youngest son Zhi Ci as King of Yue Zhang, all in the Chu barbarian lands on the Jiang River.

sentences.zh: 及周厲王之時，暴虐，熊渠畏其伐楚，亦去其王。

translations.literal: When Zhou Li Wang's time, he was tyrannical and cruel. Xiong Qu feared he would attack Chu, so he also removed their wang titles.
translations.idiomatic: When the time of King Li of Zhou came, he was tyrannical and cruel. Xiong Qu feared he would attack Chu, so he also removed their king titles.

sentences.zh: 後為熊毋康，毋康蚤死。

translations.literal: Later he became Xiong Wu Kang, and Wu Kang died early.
translations.idiomatic: Later he became Xiong Wu Kang, and Wu Kang died early.

sentences.zh: 熊渠卒，子熊摯紅立。

translations.literal: Xiong Qu died, and his son Xiong Zhi Hong was established.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Qu died, and his son Xiong Zhi Hong was established.

sentences.zh: 摯紅卒，其弟弒而代立，曰熊延。

translations.literal: Zhi Hong died, and his younger brother assassinated him and replaced him as established, named Xiong Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Zhi Hong died, and his younger brother assassinated him and replaced him as established, named Xiong Yan.

sentences.zh: 熊延生熊勇。

translations.literal: Xiong Yan begot Xiong Yong.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Yan begot Xiong Yong.

sentences.zh: 熊勇六年，而周人作亂，攻厲王，厲王出奔彘。

translations.literal: In Xiong Yong's sixth year, the Zhou people made rebellion, attacked Li Wang, and Li Wang fled to Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiong Yong's sixth year, the Zhou people made rebellion, attacked King Li, and King Li fled to Zhi.

sentences.zh: 熊勇十年，卒，弟熊嚴為後。

translations.literal: In Xiong Yong's tenth year, he died, and his younger brother Xiong Yan became successor.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiong Yong's tenth year, he died, and his younger brother Xiong Yan became his successor.

sentences.zh: 熊嚴十年，卒。

translations.literal: In Xiong Yan's tenth year, he died.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiong Yan's tenth year, he died.

sentences.zh: 有子四人，長子伯霜，中子仲雪，次子叔堪，少子季徇。

translations.literal: He had four sons: eldest Bo Shuang, middle Zhong Xue, next Shu Kan, youngest Ji Xun.
translations.idiomatic: He had four sons: the eldest Bo Shuang, the middle Zhong Xue, the next Shu Kan, and the youngest Ji Xun.

sentences.zh: 熊嚴卒，長子伯霜代立，是為熊霜。

translations.literal: Xiong Yan died, and his eldest son Bo Shuang replaced him as established. This was Xiong Shuang.
translations.idiomatic: Xiong Yan died, and his eldest son Bo Shuang replaced him as established. The one who was established became known as Xiong Shuang.

sentences.zh: 熊霜元年，周宣王初立。

translations.literal: In Xiong Shuang's first year, Zhou Xuan Wang was first established.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiong Shuang's first year, King Xuan of Zhou was first established.

sentences.zh: 熊霜六年，卒，三弟爭立。

translations.literal: In Xiong Shuang's sixth year, he died, and his three younger brothers contended for establishment.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiong Shuang's sixth year, he died, and his three younger brothers contended for establishment.

sentences.zh: 仲雪死；

translations.literal: Zhong Xue died;
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Xue died;

sentences.zh: 叔堪亡，避難於濮；

translations.literal: Shu Kan fled, avoided difficulty at Pu;
translations.idiomatic: Shu Kan fled and took refuge at Pu.

sentences.zh: 而少弟季徇立，是為熊徇。

translations.literal: But the youngest brother Ji Xun was established. This was Xiong Xun.
translations.idiomatic: But the youngest brother Ji Xun was established. This became known as Xiong Xun.

sentences.zh: 熊徇十六年，鄭桓公初封於鄭。

translations.literal: In Xiong Xun's sixteenth year, Zheng Huan Gong was first enfeoffed at Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiong Xun's sixteenth year, Duke Huan of Zheng was first enfeoffed at Zheng.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，熊徇卒，子熊咢立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Xiong Xun died, and his son Xiong E was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Xiong Xun died, and his son Xiong E was established.

sentences.zh: 熊咢九年，卒，子熊儀立，是為若敖。

translations.literal: In Xiong E's ninth year, he died, and his son Xiong Yi was established. This was Ruo Ao.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiong E's ninth year, he died, and his son Xiong Yi was established. The one who was established became known as Ruo Ao.

sentences.zh: 若敖二十年，周幽王為犬戎所弒，周東徙，而秦襄公始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: In Ruo Ao's twentieth year, Zhou You Wang was assassinated by Quan Rong, Zhou moved east, and Qin Xiang Gong began to be ranked as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In Ruo Ao's twentieth year, King You of Zhou was assassinated by the Quan Rong, Zhou moved east, and Duke Xiang of Qin began to be ranked as a feudal lord.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，若敖卒，子熊坎立，是為霄敖。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, Ruo Ao died, and his son Xiong Kan was established. This was Xiao Ao.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, Ruo Ao died, and his son Xiong Kan was established. This became known as Xiao Ao.

sentences.zh: 霄敖六年，卒，子熊眴立，是為蚡冒。

translations.literal: In Xiao Ao's sixth year, he died, and his son Xiong Shen was established. This was Fen Mao.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiao Ao's sixth year, he died, and his son Xiong Shen was established. The one who was established became known as Fen Mao.

sentences.zh: 蚡冒十三年，晉始亂，以曲沃之故。

translations.literal: In Fen Mao's thirteenth year, Jin began disorder, because of Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: In Fen Mao's thirteenth year, Jin began to fall into disorder, because of the matter of Qu Wo.

sentences.zh: 蚡冒十七年，卒。

translations.literal: In Fen Mao's seventeenth year, he died.
translations.idiomatic: In Fen Mao's seventeenth year, he died.

sentences.zh: 蚡冒弟熊通弒蚡冒子而代立，是為楚武王。

translations.literal: Fen Mao's younger brother Xiong Tong assassinated Fen Mao's son and replaced him as established. This was Chu Wu Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Fen Mao's younger brother Xiong Tong assassinated Fen Mao's son and replaced him as established. The one who was established became known as King Wu of Chu.

sentences.zh: 武王十七年，晉之曲沃莊伯弒主國晉孝侯。

translations.literal: Wu Wang seventeenth year, Jin's Qu Wo Zhuang Bo assassinated main state Jin Xiao Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In King Wu's seventeenth year, Jin's Zhuang Bo of Qu Wo assassinated the main state's Duke Xiao of Jin.

sentences.zh: 十九年，鄭伯弟段作亂。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, Zheng bo's younger brother Duan made rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, the Zheng lord's younger brother Duan made rebellion.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，鄭侵天子之田。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Zheng invaded the tian zi's fields.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, Zheng invaded the Son of Heaven's fields.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，衛弒其君桓公。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Wei assassinated their lord Huan Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Wei assassinated their lord Duke Huan.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，魯弒其君隱公。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Lu assassinated their lord Yin Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Lu assassinated their lord Duke Yin.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，宋太宰華督弒其君殤公。

translations.literal: In the thirty-first year, Song grand steward Hua Du assassinated their lord Shang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, Song's grand steward Hua Du assassinated their lord Duke Shang.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，楚伐隨。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fifth year, Chu attacked Sui.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, Chu attacked Sui.

sentences.zh: 隨曰：「我無罪。」

translations.literal: Sui said: 'I no crime.'
translations.idiomatic: Sui said: 'I have committed no crime.'

sentences.zh: 楚曰：「我蠻夷也。

translations.literal: Chu said: 'I barbarian Yi.
translations.idiomatic: Chu said: 'I am a barbarian Yi.

sentences.zh: 今諸侯皆為叛相侵，或相殺。

translations.literal: Now the feudal lords all become rebels who mutually invade, or mutually kill.
translations.idiomatic: Now the feudal lords have all become rebels who mutually invade, or mutually kill.

sentences.zh: 我有敝甲，欲以觀中國之政，請王室尊吾號。」

translations.literal: I have worn armor, desire with observe central states governance, request wang chamber honor my title.'
translations.idiomatic: I have worn armor and desire to observe the governance of the central states. I request the royal house to honor my title.'

sentences.zh: 隨人為之周，請尊楚，王室不聽，還報楚。

translations.literal: The Sui people acted as intermediaries for them and requested to honor Chu. The wang chamber did not listen and returned to report to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: The Sui people acted as intermediaries for them and requested to honor Chu. The royal house did not listen and returned to report to Chu.

sentences.zh: 三十七年，楚熊通怒曰：「吾先鬻熊，文王之師也，蚤終。

translations.literal: Thirty-seventh year, Chu Xiong Tong angered said: 'My ancestor Yu Xiong, Wen Wang teacher, early ended.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-seventh year, Chu's Xiong Tong angrily said: 'My ancestor Yu Xiong was King Wen's teacher, but he ended early.

sentences.zh: 成王舉我先公，乃以子男田令居楚，蠻夷皆率服，而王不加位，我自尊耳。」

translations.literal: Cheng Wang raised my first duke, then with zi nan fields ordered reside Chu, barbarian Yi all led submit, but wang not added position, I self honor.'
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng raised my first duke, then with zi and nan fields ordered him to reside in Chu. The barbarian Yi all led and submitted, but the king did not add to my position. I will honor myself.'

sentences.zh: 乃自立為武王，與隨人盟而去。

translations.literal: He then self-established as Wu Wang, allied with the Sui people, and departed.
translations.idiomatic: He then established himself as King Wu, allied with the Sui people, and departed.

sentences.zh: 於是始開濮地而有之。

translations.literal: Thereupon he began to open the Pu lands and possess them.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he began to open the Pu lands and possess them.

sentences.zh: 五十一年，周召隨侯，數以立楚為王。

translations.literal: In the fifty-first year, Zhou summoned the Sui hou and reproached him for establishing Chu as wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-first year, Zhou summoned the Sui lord and reproached him for establishing Chu as king.

sentences.zh: 楚怒，以隨背己，伐隨。

translations.literal: Chu was angered because Sui turned back on them and attacked Sui.
translations.idiomatic: Chu was angered because Sui turned back on them and attacked Sui.

sentences.zh: 武王卒師中而兵罷。

translations.literal: Wu Wang died in the midst of the army and the troops were dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu died in the midst of the army and the troops were dismissed.

sentences.zh: 子文王熊貲立，始都郢。

translations.literal: His son Wen Wang Xiong Zi was established and began to make Ying the capital.
translations.idiomatic: His son King Wen Xiong Zi was established and began to make Ying the capital.

sentences.zh: 文王二年，伐申過鄧，鄧人曰「楚王易取」，鄧侯不許也。

translations.literal: Wen Wang second year, attacked Shen passed Deng, Deng people said 'Chu wang easy take', Deng hou not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: In King Wen's second year, he attacked Shen and passed through Deng. The Deng people said 'The Chu king is easy to capture', but the Deng lord did not permit it.

sentences.zh: 六年，伐蔡，虜蔡哀侯以歸，已而釋之。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, he attacked Cai, captured Cai Ai Hou to return, and then released him.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, he attacked Cai, captured Duke Ai of Cai and returned with him, and then released him.

sentences.zh: 楚彊，陵江漢閒小國，小國皆畏之。

translations.literal: Chu was strong and overawed the small countries between Jiang and Han. The small countries all feared it.
translations.idiomatic: Chu was strong and overawed the small countries between the Jiang and Han rivers. The small countries all feared it.

sentences.zh: 十一年，齊桓公始霸，楚亦始大。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Qi Huan Gong began his hegemony, and Chu also began to become great.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Duke Huan of Qi began his hegemony, and Chu also began to become great.

sentences.zh: 十二年，伐鄧，滅之。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, he attacked Deng and extinguished it.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, he attacked Deng and extinguished it.

sentences.zh: 十三年，卒，子熊艱立，是為莊敖。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, he died, and his son Xiong Jian was established. This was Zhuang Ao.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, he died, and his son Xiong Jian was established. This became known as Zhuang Ao.

sentences.zh: 莊敖五年，欲殺其弟熊惲，惲奔隨，與隨襲弒莊敖代立，是為成王。

translations.literal: In Zhuang Ao's fifth year, he desired to kill his younger brother Xiong Yun. Yun fled to Sui and with Sui attacked, assassinated Zhuang Ao, and replaced him as established. This was Cheng Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In Zhuang Ao's fifth year, he desired to kill his younger brother Xiong Yun. Yun fled to Sui and with the Sui people attacked, assassinated Zhuang Ao, and replaced him as established. The one who was established became known as King Cheng.

sentences.zh: 成王惲元年，初即位，布德施惠，結舊好於諸侯。

translations.literal: In Cheng Wang Yun's first year, initially ascending the throne, he spread virtue and applied favor, tying old friendships with the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In King Cheng Yun's first year, initially ascending the throne, he spread virtue and applied favor, tying old friendships with the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 使人獻天子，天子賜胙，曰：「鎮爾南方夷越之亂，無侵中國。」

translations.literal: Sent people offered tian zi, tian zi granted blessing, said: 'Pacify your southern Yi Yue disorder, do not invade central states.'
translations.idiomatic: He sent people to offer tribute to the Son of Heaven, and the Son of Heaven granted a blessing, saying: 'Pacify the disorder of the southern Yi and Yue, and do not invade the central states.'

sentences.zh: 於是楚地千里。

translations.literal: Thereupon Chu's lands were a thousand li.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Chu's lands extended for a thousand li.

sentences.zh: 十六年，齊桓公以兵侵楚，至陘山。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Qi Huan Gong with troops invaded Chu and arrived at Xing Mountain.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Duke Huan of Qi with troops invaded Chu and arrived at Xing Mountain.

sentences.zh: 楚成王使將軍屈完以兵御之，與桓公盟。

translations.idiomatic: King Zhuang said: 'If their lord can humble himself before the others, he must be able to trust and use his people. How can we cut them off!'

sentences.zh: 莊王自手旗，左右麾軍，引兵去三十里而舍，遂許之平。

translations.literal: Zhuang Wang personally held the flag and waved the army with his left and right. He led the troops to depart thirty li and camped, then permitted peace.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhuang personally held the flag and waved the army with his left and right. He led the troops to depart thirty li and camped, then permitted peace.

sentences.zh: 潘尪入盟，子良出質。

translations.literal: Pan Wang entered to ally, and Zi Liang went out as hostage.
translations.idiomatic: Pan Wang entered to make an alliance, and Zi Liang went out as a hostage.

sentences.zh: 夏六月，晉救鄭，與楚戰，大敗晉師河上，遂至衡雍而歸。

translations.literal: In summer, sixth month, Jin saved Zheng and battled with Chu. They greatly defeated the Jin army on the river upper, then arrived at Heng Yong and returned.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month of summer, Jin came to rescue Zheng and battled with Chu. They greatly defeated the Jin army on the river, then arrived at Heng Yong and returned.

sentences.zh: 二十年，圍宋，以殺楚使也。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, he surrounded Song because they had killed a Chu envoy.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, he surrounded Song because they had killed a Chu envoy.

sentences.zh: 圍宋五月，城中食盡，易子而食，析骨而炊。

translations.literal: He surrounded Song for five months. Food in the city was exhausted. They exchanged sons to eat and split bones to cook.
translations.idiomatic: He surrounded Song for five months. Food in the city was exhausted. They exchanged sons to eat and split bones to cook.

sentences.zh: 宋華元出告以情。

translations.literal: Song Hua Yuan went out and told the situation.
translations.idiomatic: Hua Yuan of Song went out and told the situation.

sentences.zh: 莊王曰：「君子哉！」

translations.literal: Zhuang Wang said: 'Superior man!'
translations.idiomatic: King Zhuang said: 'He is indeed a superior man!'

sentences.zh: 遂罷兵去。

translations.literal: He then dismissed the troops and departed.
translations.idiomatic: He then dismissed the troops and departed.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，莊王卒，子共王審立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Zhuang Wang died, and his son Gong Wang Shen was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, King Zhuang died, and his son King Gong Shen was established.

sentences.zh: 共王十六年，晉伐鄭。

translations.literal: In Gong Wang's sixteenth year, Jin attacked Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In King Gong's sixteenth year, Jin attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 鄭告急，共王救鄭。

translations.literal: Zheng reported urgent, and Gong Wang saved Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: Zheng reported the urgent situation, and King Gong came to rescue Zheng.

sentences.zh: 與晉兵戰鄢陵，晉敗楚，射中共王目。

translations.literal: He battled with Jin troops at Yan Ling. Jin defeated Chu and shot, hitting Gong Wang's eye.
translations.idiomatic: He battled with the Jin troops at Yan Ling. Jin defeated Chu and shot, hitting King Gong's eye.

sentences.zh: 共王召將軍子反。

translations.literal: Gong Wang summoned the general Zi Fan.
translations.idiomatic: King Gong summoned the general Zi Fan.

sentences.zh: 子反嗜酒，從者豎陽穀進酒醉。

translations.literal: Zi Fan was addicted to wine. His follower Shu Yang Gu presented wine and got him drunk.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Fan was addicted to wine. His follower Shu Yang Gu presented wine and got him drunk.

sentences.zh: 王怒，射殺子反，遂罷兵歸。

translations.literal: The wang was angered, shot and killed Zi Fan, then dismissed the troops and returned.
translations.idiomatic: The king was angered, shot and killed Zi Fan, then dismissed the troops and returned.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，共王卒，子康王招立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-first year, Gong Wang died, and his son Kang Wang Zhao was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, King Gong died, and his son King Kang Zhao was established.

sentences.zh: 康王立十五年卒，子員立，是為郟敖。

translations.literal: Kang Wang was established for fifteen years and died. His son Yuan was established. This was Jia Ao.
translations.idiomatic: King Kang reigned for the fifteen years and died. His son Yuan was established as the king. This was Jia Ao.

sentences.zh: 康王寵弟公子圍、子比、子皙、棄疾。

translations.literal: Kang Wang favored his younger brothers Gong zi Wei, Zi Bi, Zi Xi, and Qi Ji.
translations.idiomatic: King Kang favored the younger brothers, who were Gong zi Wei, Zi Bi, Zi Xi, and Qi Ji.

sentences.zh: 郟敖三年，以其季父康王弟公子圍為令尹，主兵事。

translations.literal: In Jia Ao's third year, he made his young uncle Kang Wang's younger brother Gong zi Wei the Ling Yin to master military affairs.
translations.idiomatic: In Jia Ao's third year, he made his young uncle King Kang's younger brother Gong zi Wei the Ling Yin to master military affairs.

sentences.zh: 四年，圍使鄭，道聞王疾而還。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Wei was envoy to Zheng, but en route heard of the wang's illness and returned.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Wei was an envoy to Zheng, but en route heard of the king's illness and returned.

sentences.zh: 十二月己酉，圍入問王疾，絞而弒之，遂殺其子莫及平夏。

translations.literal: In the twelfth month on Ji You, Wei entered and inquired about the wang's illness. He strangled and assassinated him, then killed his sons Mo and Ping Xia.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month on Ji You, Wei entered and inquired about the king's illness. He strangled and assassinated him, then killed his sons Mo and Ping Xia.

sentences.zh: 使使赴於鄭。

translations.literal: He sent an envoy to announce to Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: He sent an envoy to announce to Zheng.

sentences.zh: 伍舉問曰：「誰為後？」

translations.literal: Wu Ju asked said: 'Who for successor?'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ju asked, saying: 'Who is the successor?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「寡大夫圍。」

translations.literal: Answered said: 'Our grandee Wei.'
translations.idiomatic: He answered, saying: 'Our grandee Wei.'

sentences.zh: 伍舉更曰：「共王之子圍為長。」

translations.literal: Wu Ju changed said: 'Gong Wang son Wei for elder.'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ju then said: 'Gong Wang's son Wei is the eldest.'

sentences.zh: 子比奔晉，而圍立，是為靈王。

translations.literal: Zi Bi fled to Jin, and Wei was established. This was Ling Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Bi fled to Jin, and Wei was established. This was King Ling.

sentences.zh: 靈王三年六月，楚使使告晉，欲會諸侯。

translations.literal: In Ling Wang's third year, sixth month, Chu sent an envoy to tell Jin, desiring to meet with the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month of King Ling's third year, Chu sent an envoy to tell Jin, desiring to meet with the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 諸侯皆會楚于申。

translations.literal: The feudal lords all met Chu at Shen.
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords all met with Chu at Shen.

sentences.zh: 伍舉曰：「昔夏啟有鈞臺之饗，商湯有景亳之命，周武王有盟津之誓，成王有岐陽之閒，康王有豐宮之朝，穆王有涂山之會，齊桓有召陵之師，晉文有踐土之盟，君其何用？」

translations.literal: Wu Ju said: 'Former Xia Qi had Gou Tai feast, Shang Tang had Jing Bo command, Zhou Wu Wang had Meng Jin oath, Cheng Wang had Qi Yang meeting, Kang Wang had Feng Gong court, Mu Wang had Tu Shan assembly, Qi Huan had Zhao Ling army, Jin Wen had Jian Tu alliance, lord what use?'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ju said: 'Formerly, Xia Qi had the Gou Tai feast, Shang Tang had the Jing Bo command, King Wu of Zhou had the Meng Jin oath, King Cheng had the Qi Yang meeting, King Kang had the Feng Gong court, King Mu had the Tu Shan assembly, Duke Huan of Qi had the Zhao Ling army, and Duke Wen of Jin had the Jian Tu alliance. What will the lord use?'

sentences.zh: 靈王曰：「用桓公。」

translations.literal: Ling Wang said: 'Use Huan Gong.'
translations.idiomatic: King Ling said: 'I will use Duke Huan.'

sentences.zh: 時鄭子產在焉。

translations.literal: At the time, Zheng Zi Chan was there.
translations.idiomatic: At the time, Zi Chan of Zheng was there.

sentences.zh: 於是晉、宋、魯、衛不往。

translations.literal: Thereupon Jin, Song, Lu, and Wei did not go.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Jin, Song, Lu, and Wei did not go.

sentences.zh: 靈王已盟，有驕色。

translations.literal: Ling Wang had already allied and had an arrogant expression.
translations.idiomatic: King Ling had already made the alliance and had an arrogant expression.

sentences.zh: 伍舉曰：「桀為有仍之會，有緡叛之。

translations.literal: Wu Ju said: 'Jie for You Reng assembly, You Min rebelled him.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ju said: 'Jie held the You Reng assembly, and You Min rebelled against him.

sentences.zh: 紂為黎山之會，東夷叛之。

translations.literal: Zhou held the Li Shan assembly, and the eastern Yi rebelled against him.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou held the Li Shan assembly, and the eastern Yi rebelled against him.

sentences.zh: 幽王為太室之盟，戎、翟叛之。

translations.literal: You Wang held the Tai Shi alliance, and the Rong and Di rebelled against him.
translations.idiomatic: King You held the Tai Shi alliance, and the Rong and Di rebelled against him.

sentences.zh: 君其慎終！」

translations.literal: Lord be careful end!'
translations.idiomatic: The lord should be careful of the end!'

sentences.zh: 七月，楚以諸侯兵伐吳，圍朱方。

translations.literal: In the seventh month, Chu with the feudal lords' troops attacked Wu and surrounded Zhu Fang.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month, Chu attacked Wu with the feudal lords' troops and surrounded Zhu Fang.

sentences.zh: 八月，克之，囚慶封，滅其族。

translations.literal: In the eighth month, he conquered it, imprisoned Qing Feng, and extinguished his clan.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, he conquered it, imprisoned Qing Feng, and extinguished his clan.

sentences.zh: 以封徇，曰：「無效齊慶封弒其君而弱其孤，以盟諸大夫！」

translations.literal: With territory paraded, said: 'Do not imitate Qi Qing Feng assassinated his lord and weakened his orphan, to ally various grandees!'
translations.idiomatic: He paraded Feng and said: 'Do not imitate Qi Qing Feng, who assassinated his lord and weakened his orphan, to ally with the various grandees!'

sentences.zh: 封反曰：「莫如楚共王庶子圍弒其君兄之子員而代之立！」

translations.literal: Feng countered said: 'Nothing like Chu Gong Wang concubine son Wei assassinated his lord elder brother son Yuan and replaced established!'
translations.idiomatic: Feng countered, saying: 'Nothing is like Chu Gong Wang's concubine son Wei, who assassinated the lord elder brother's son Yuan and replaced him to be established!'

sentences.zh: 於是靈王使（棄）疾殺之。

translations.literal: Thereupon Ling Wang sent (Qi) Ji kill him.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon King Ling sent Qi Ji to kill him.

sentences.zh: 七年，就章華臺，下令內亡人實之。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, he completed the Zhang Hua Tai and issued an order for inner fleeing people to fill it.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, he completed the Zhang Hua Tai and issued an order for those who had fled within to fill it.

sentences.zh: 八年，使公子棄疾將兵滅陳。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, he sent Gong zi Qi Ji to lead troops and extinguish Chen.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, he sent Gong zi Qi Ji to lead troops and extinguish Chen.

sentences.zh: 十年，召蔡侯，醉而殺之。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, he summoned the Cai hou, got him drunk, and killed him.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, he summoned the Cai hou, got him drunk, and killed him.

sentences.zh: 使棄疾定蔡，因為陳蔡公。

translations.literal: He sent Qi Ji to pacify Cai and became the Chen Cai gong.
translations.idiomatic: He sent Qi Ji to pacify Cai and made him the Chen Cai gong.

sentences.zh: 十一年，伐徐以恐吳。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, he attacked Xu to frighten Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, he attacked Xu to frighten Wu.

sentences.zh: 靈王次於乾豀以待之。

translations.literal: Ling Wang lodged at Qian Xi to await them.
translations.idiomatic: King Ling lodged at Qian Xi to await them.

sentences.zh: 王曰：「齊、晉、魯、衛，其封皆受寶器，我獨不。

translations.literal: Wang said: 'Qi, Jin, Lu, Wei, their enfeoffments all received precious vessels, I alone not.
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'Qi, Jin, Lu, and Wei, their enfeoffments all received precious vessels, but I alone did not.

sentences.zh: 今吾使使周求鼎以為分，其予我乎？」

translations.literal: Now I send envoy Zhou seek tripods as share, will give me?'
translations.idiomatic: Now I send an envoy to Zhou to seek tripods as my share. Will they give them to me?'

sentences.zh: 析父對曰：「其予君王哉！

translations.literal: Xi Fu answered said: 'Will give lord wang!
translations.idiomatic: Xi Fu answered, saying: 'They will give them to the lord king!

sentences.zh: 昔我先王熊繹辟在荊山，蓽露藍蔞以處草莽，跋涉山林以事天子，唯是桃弧棘矢以共王事。

translations.literal: Formerly our former wang Xiong Yi avoided being at Jing Shan. He exposed himself to dew and blue vines to dwell in the grass wilds. He trudged through mountains and forests to serve the heavenly son, contributing only peach bows and thorn arrows to the wang's affairs.
translations.idiomatic: Formerly our former king Xiong Yi avoided being at Jing Shan. He exposed himself to dew and blue vines to dwell in the grass wilds. He trudged through mountains and forests to serve the Son of Heaven, contributing only peach bows and thorn arrows to the king's affairs.

sentences.zh: 齊，王舅也；

translations.literal: Qi, wang maternal uncle;
translations.idiomatic: Qi is the king's maternal uncle;

sentences.zh: 晉及魯、衛，王母弟也：楚是以無分而彼皆有。

translations.literal: Jin and Lu, Wei, wang maternal younger brothers: Chu therefore no share but they all have.
translations.idiomatic: Jin, Lu, and Wei are the king's maternal younger brothers. Chu therefore has no share, but they all have one.

sentences.zh: 周今與四國服事君王，將惟命是從，豈敢愛鼎？」

translations.literal: Zhou now with four states serve lord wang, will only command follow, how dare cherish tripods?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhou now with the four states serves the lord king and will only follow your command. How dare we cherish the tripods?'

sentences.zh: 靈王曰：「昔我皇祖伯父昆吾舊許是宅，今鄭人貪其田，不我予，今我求之，其予我乎？」

translations.literal: Ling Wang said: 'Former my imperial ancestor uncle Kun Wu old promised this residence, now Zheng people greedy their fields, not give me, now I seek it, will give me?'
translations.idiomatic: King Ling said: 'Formerly my imperial ancestor uncle Kun Wu's old residence was at Xu. Now the Zheng people are greedy for its fields and do not give them to me. Now I seek them. Will they give them to me?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「周不愛鼎，鄭安敢愛田？」

translations.literal: Answered said: 'Zhou not cherish tripods, Zheng how dare cherish fields?'
translations.idiomatic: He answered, saying: 'If Zhou does not cherish the tripods, how dare Zheng cherish the fields?'

sentences.zh: 靈王曰：「昔諸侯遠我而畏晉，今吾大城陳、蔡、不羹，賦皆千乘，諸侯畏我乎？」

translations.literal: Ling Wang said: 'Former feudal lords distant me feared Jin, now I great walled Chen, Cai, Bu Geng, levies all thousand chariots, feudal lords fear me?'
translations.idiomatic: King Ling said: 'Formerly the feudal lords were distant from me and feared Jin. Now I have greatly walled Chen, Cai, and Bu Geng, and the levies are all a thousand chariots. Do the feudal lords fear me?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「畏哉！」

translations.literal: Answered said: 'Fear!'
translations.idiomatic: He answered, saying: 'They fear indeed!'

sentences.zh: 靈王喜曰：「析父善言古事焉。」

translations.literal: Ling Wang pleased said: 'Xi Fu good at speaking ancient matters.'
translations.idiomatic: King Ling was pleased and said: 'Xi Fu is good at speaking of ancient matters.'

sentences.zh: 十二年春，楚靈王樂乾豀，不能去也。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, spring, Chu Ling Wang enjoyed Qian Xi and could not depart.
translations.idiomatic: In the spring of the twelfth year, King Ling of Chu enjoyed Qian Xi and could not depart.

sentences.zh: 國人苦役。

translations.literal: The state people suffered from the corvee.
translations.idiomatic: The people of the state suffered from the corvee.

sentences.zh: 初，靈王會兵於申，僇越大夫常壽過，殺蔡大夫觀起。

translations.literal: Initially, Ling Wang assembled troops at Shen, executed Yue grandee Chang Shou Guo, and killed Cai grandee Guan Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, King Ling assembled troops at Shen, executed the Yue grandee Chang Shou Guo, and killed the Cai grandee Guan Qi.

sentences.zh: 起子從亡在吳，乃勸吳王伐楚，為閒越大夫常壽過而作亂，為吳閒。

translations.literal: Qi's son Cong fled and was in Wu. He then urged the Wu wang to attack Chu, to alienate Yue grandee Chang Shou Guo and make him rebel, acting as alienation for Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Qi's son Cong fled and was in Wu. He then urged the Wu king to attack Chu, to alienate the Yue grandee Chang Shou Guo and make him rebel, acting as a spy for Wu.

sentences.zh: 使矯公子棄疾命召公子比於晉，至蔡，與吳、越兵欲襲蔡。

translations.literal: He sent a falsified command from Gong zi Qi Ji to summon Gong zi Bi from Jin. He arrived at Cai and, with Wu and Yue troops, desired to attack Cai.
translations.idiomatic: He sent a falsified command from Gong zi Qi Ji to summon Gong zi Bi from Jin. He arrived at Cai and, with Wu and Yue troops, desired to attack Cai.

sentences.zh: 令公子比見棄疾，與盟於鄧。

translations.literal: He commanded Gong zi Bi to see Qi Ji and ally at Deng.
translations.idiomatic: He commanded Gong zi Bi to see Qi Ji and make an alliance at Deng.

sentences.zh: 遂入殺靈王太子祿，立子比為王，公子子皙為令尹，棄疾為司馬。

translations.literal: They then entered and killed Ling Wang's crown prince Lu. They established Zi Bi as wang, Gong zi Zi Xi as Ling Yin, and Qi Ji as Si Ma.
translations.idiomatic: They then entered and killed King Ling's crown prince Lu. They established Zi Bi as the king, Gong zi Zi Xi as the Ling Yin, and Qi Ji as the Si Ma.

sentences.zh: 先除王宮，觀從從師于乾豀，令楚眾曰：「國有王矣。

translations.literal: First cleared wang palace, Guan Cong followed army at Qian Xi, commanded Chu masses said: 'State has wang.
translations.idiomatic: First they cleared the king's palace. Guan Cong followed the army at Qian Xi and commanded the Chu masses, saying: 'The state has a king.

sentences.zh: 先歸，復爵邑田室。

translations.literal: Those who return first will have their ranks, fiefs, fields, and chambers restored.
translations.idiomatic: Those who return first will have their ranks, fiefs, fields, and chambers restored.

sentences.zh: 後者遷之。」

translations.literal: Later ones move them.'
translations.idiomatic: Those who return later will be moved.'

sentences.zh: 楚眾皆潰，去靈王而歸。

translations.literal: The Chu masses all collapsed and departed from Ling Wang to return.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu masses all collapsed and departed from King Ling to return.

sentences.zh: 靈王聞太子祿之死也，自投車下，而曰：「人之愛子亦如是乎？」

translations.literal: Ling Wang heard crown prince Lu's death, self threw under chariot, and said: 'People's love for sons also like this?'
translations.idiomatic: When King Ling heard of crown prince Lu's death, he threw himself under the chariot and said: 'Do people love their sons like this?'

sentences.zh: 侍者曰：「甚是。」

translations.literal: Attendant said: 'Very correct.'
translations.idiomatic: The attendant said: 'Very much so.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「余殺人之子多矣，能無及此乎？」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'I killed people's sons many, can not reach this?'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'I have killed many people's sons. Can it not reach this?'

sentences.zh: 右尹曰：「請待於郊以聽國人。」

translations.literal: Right Yin said: 'Please wait at suburbs to listen to state people.'
translations.idiomatic: The Right Yin said: 'Please wait at the suburbs to listen to the people of the state.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「眾怒不可犯。」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'Masses anger cannot violate.'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'The anger of the masses cannot be violated.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「且入大縣而乞師於諸侯。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Moreover enter large county and beg troops from feudal lords.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Moreover, enter a large county and beg for troops from the feudal lords.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「皆叛矣。」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'All rebelled.'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'They have all rebelled.'

sentences.zh: 又曰：「且奔諸侯以聽大國之慮。」

translations.literal: Again said: 'Moreover flee to feudal lords to listen to great states' considerations.'
translations.idiomatic: He again said: 'Moreover, flee to the feudal lords to listen to the great states' considerations.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「大福不再，祗取辱耳。」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'Great fortune not again, only take humiliation.'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'Great fortune does not come again. I will only take humiliation.'

sentences.zh: 於是王乘舟將欲入鄢。

translations.literal: Thereupon the wang boarded a boat and desired to enter Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the king boarded a boat and desired to enter Yan.

sentences.zh: 右尹度王不用其計，懼俱死，亦去王亡。

translations.literal: The Right Yin saw that the wang would not use his plan. He feared they would die together and also departed from the wang and fled.
translations.idiomatic: The Right Yin saw that the king would not use his plan. He feared they would die together and also departed from the king and fled.

sentences.zh: 靈王於是獨傍偟山中，野人莫敢入王。

translations.literal: Ling Wang was then alone beside Sao Mountain. No wild people dared to approach the wang.
translations.idiomatic: King Ling was then alone beside Sao Mountain. No wild people dared to approach the king.

sentences.zh: 王行遇其故鋗人，謂曰：「為我求食，我已不食三日矣。」

translations.literal: Wang walking encountered his former armor smith, told said: 'For me seek food, I already not eat three days.'
translations.idiomatic: The king, while walking, encountered his former armor smith and told him, saying: 'Seek food for me. I have not eaten for three days.'

sentences.zh: 鋗人曰：「新王下法，有敢閒王從王者，罪及三族，且又無所得食。」

translations.literal: Armor smith said: 'New wang issued law, have dare secretly wang follow wang, crime reaches three clans, moreover also no obtain food.'
translations.idiomatic: The armor smith said: 'The new king has issued a law. Those who dare to secretly follow the king will have their crime reach three clans. Moreover, there is also no food to be obtained.'

sentences.zh: 王因枕其股而臥。

translations.literal: The wang then pillowed his thigh and lay down.
translations.idiomatic: The king then pillowed his head on the armor smith's thigh and lay down.

sentences.zh: 鋗人又以土自代，逃去。

translations.literal: The armor smith again used earth to substitute for himself and escaped.
translations.idiomatic: The armor smith again used earth to substitute for himself and escaped.

sentences.zh: 王覺而弗見，遂饑弗能起。

translations.literal: The wang awoke and did not see him. He was then hungry and could not rise.
translations.idiomatic: The king awoke and did not see him. He was then hungry and could not rise.

sentences.zh: 奢曰：「尚之為人，廉，死節，慈孝而仁，聞召而免父，必至，不顧其死。

translations.literal: She said: 'Shang's character, upright, die for integrity, filial compassionate benevolent, hear summon save father, certainly arrive, not consider his death.
translations.idiomatic: She said: 'Shang's character is upright. He will die for integrity. He is filial, compassionate, and benevolent. When he hears the summons to save his father, he will certainly arrive and not consider his own death.

sentences.zh: 胥之為人，智而好謀，勇而矜功，知來必死，必不來。

translations.literal: Xu's character, wise good planning, brave proud merit, know come certainly die, certainly not come.
translations.idiomatic: Xu's character is wise and good at the art of planning. He is brave and proud of his merit. He knows that if he comes, he will certainly die, so he will certainly not come.

sentences.zh: 然為楚國憂者必此子。」

translations.literal: However for Chu state worry certainly this son.'
translations.idiomatic: However, the one who will worry Chu state is certainly this son.'

sentences.zh: 於是王使人召之，曰：「來，吾免爾父。」

translations.literal: Thereupon wang sent person summon them, said: 'Come, I pardon your father.'
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the king sent a person to summon them, saying: 'Come, and I will pardon your father.'

sentences.zh: 伍尚謂伍胥曰：「聞父免而莫奔，不孝也；

translations.literal: Wu Shang told Wu Xu said: 'Hear father pardoned and not hasten, unfilial;
translations.idiomatic: Wu Shang told Wu Xu, saying: 'To hear that the father is pardoned and not hasten is unfilial;

sentences.zh: 父戮莫報，無謀也；

translations.literal: Father executed not avenge, no plan;
translations.idiomatic: if father is executed and not avenged, there is no plan;

sentences.zh: 度能任事，知也。

translations.literal: To assess what one can undertake is wisdom.
translations.idiomatic: to assess what one can undertake is wisdom.

sentences.zh: 子其行矣，我其歸死。」

translations.literal: You go, I return die.'
translations.idiomatic: You go, and I will return to die.'

sentences.zh: 伍尚遂歸。

translations.literal: Wu Shang then returned.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Shang then returned.

sentences.zh: 伍胥彎弓屬矢，出見使者，曰：「父有罪，何以召其子為？」

translations.literal: Wu Xu bent bow attached arrow, out saw envoy, said: 'Father has crime, why summon his son for?'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Xu bent his bow and attached an arrow. He went out to see the envoy and said: 'If father has a crime, why summon his son for it?'

sentences.zh: 將射，使者還走，遂出奔吳。

translations.literal: He was about to shoot when the envoy turned and ran away. He then fled out to Wu.
translations.idiomatic: He was about to shoot when the envoy turned and ran away. He then fled out to Wu.

sentences.zh: 伍奢聞之，曰：「胥亡，楚國危哉。」

translations.literal: Wu She heard it, said: 'Xu fled, Chu state in danger!'
translations.idiomatic: Wu She heard it and said: 'Xu has fled. The Chu state is in danger!'

sentences.zh: 楚人遂殺伍奢及尚。

translations.literal: The Chu people then killed Wu She and Shang.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu people then killed Wu She and Shang.

sentences.zh: 十年，楚太子建母在居巢，開吳。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Chu crown prince Jian's mother was at Ju Chao and opened it to Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, the Chu crown prince Jian's mother was at Ju Chao and opened it to Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳使公子光伐楚，遂敗陳、蔡，取太子建母而去。

translations.literal: Wu sent Gong zi Guang to attack Chu. He then defeated Chen and Cai, took crown prince Jian's mother, and departed.
translations.idiomatic: Wu sent Gong zi Guang to attack Chu. He then defeated Chen and Cai, took the crown prince Jian's mother, and departed.

sentences.zh: 楚恐，城郢。

translations.literal: Chu feared and walled Ying.
translations.idiomatic: Chu feared and walled Ying.

sentences.zh: 初，吳之邊邑卑梁與楚邊邑鐘離小童爭桑，兩家交怒相攻，滅卑梁人。

translations.literal: Initially, Wu's border town Bei Liang and Chu's border town Zhong Li had young boys disputing over mulberries. The two families became mutually angered and attacked each other, extinguishing the Bei Liang people.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Wu's border town Bei Liang and Chu's border town Zhong Li had young boys disputing over mulberries. The two families became mutually angered and attacked each other, extinguishing the Bei Liang people.

sentences.zh: 卑梁大夫怒，發邑兵攻鐘離。

translations.literal: The Bei Liang grandee was angered and mobilized town troops to attack Zhong Li.
translations.idiomatic: The Bei Liang grandee was angered and mobilized town troops to attack Zhong Li.

sentences.zh: 楚王聞之怒，發國兵滅卑梁。

translations.literal: The Chu wang heard and was angered. He mobilized state troops and extinguished Bei Liang.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu king heard and was angered. He mobilized state troops and extinguished Bei Liang.

sentences.zh: 吳王聞之大怒，亦發兵，使公子光因建母家攻楚，遂滅鐘離、居巢。

translations.literal: The Wu wang heard and was greatly angered. He also mobilized troops and sent Gong zi Guang to attack Chu through Jian's mother's home. He then extinguished Zhong Li and Ju Chao.
translations.idiomatic: The Wu king heard and was greatly angered. He also mobilized troops and sent Gong zi Guang to attack Chu through Jian's mother's home. He then extinguished Zhong Li and Ju Chao.

sentences.zh: 楚乃恐而城郢。

translations.literal: Chu then feared and walled Ying.
translations.idiomatic: Chu then feared and walled Ying.

sentences.zh: 十三年，平王卒。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Ping Wang died.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, King Ping died.

sentences.zh: 將軍子常曰：「太子珍少，且其母乃前太子建所當娶也。」

translations.literal: General Zi Chang said: 'Crown prince Zhen young, moreover his mother was former crown prince Jian should marry.'
translations.idiomatic: General Zi Chang said: 'Crown prince Zhen is young, and moreover his mother was the one that the former crown prince Jian should have married.'

sentences.zh: 欲立令尹子西。

translations.literal: He desired to establish Ling Yin Zi Xi.
translations.idiomatic: He desired to establish Ling Yin Zi Xi.

sentences.zh: 子西，平王之庶弟也，有義。

translations.literal: Zi Xi was Ping Wang's concubine younger brother and had righteousness.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xi was King Ping's concubine younger brother and had righteousness.

sentences.zh: 子西曰：「國有常法，更立則亂，言之則致誅。」

translations.literal: Zi Xi said: 'State has constant law, change establish then disorder, speak then bring execution.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xi said: 'The state has constant law. To change the establishment brings disorder, and to speak of it brings execution.'

sentences.zh: 乃立太子珍，是為昭王。

translations.literal: They then established crown prince Zhen. This was Zhao Wang.
translations.idiomatic: They then established crown prince Zhen. This was King Zhao.

sentences.zh: 昭王元年，楚眾不說費無忌，以其讒亡太子建，殺伍奢子父與郤宛。

translations.literal: In Zhao Wang's first year, the Chu masses were not pleased with Fei Wu Ji because his slander caused crown prince Jian to flee. They killed Wu She and his sons, and Xi Wan.
translations.idiomatic: In King Zhao's first year, the Chu masses were not pleased with Fei Wu Ji because his slander caused crown prince Jian to flee. They killed Wu She and his sons, and Xi Wan.

sentences.zh: 宛之宗姓伯氏子及子胥皆奔吳，吳兵數侵楚，楚人怨無忌甚。

translations.literal: Wan's clan surname Bai clan sons and Zi Xu all fled Wu, Wu troops frequently invaded Chu, Chu people resented Wu Ji very much.
translations.idiomatic: Wan's clan surname Bai clan sons and Zi Xu all fled to Wu. Wu troops frequently invaded Chu, and the Chu people resented Wu Ji very much.

sentences.zh: 楚令尹子常誅無忌以說眾，眾乃喜。

translations.literal: Chu Ling Yin Zi Chang executed Wu Ji to please the masses, and the masses were then happy.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu Ling Yin Zi Chang executed Wu Ji to please the masses, and the masses were then happy.

sentences.zh: 四年，吳三公子奔楚，楚封之以捍吳。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Wu's three gong zi fled to Chu. Chu enfeoffed them to defend against Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Wu's three gong zi fled to Chu. Chu enfeoffed them to defend against Wu.

sentences.zh: 五年，吳伐取楚之六、潛。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Wu attacked took Chu's Liu, Qian.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Wu attacked and took Chu's Liu and Qian.

sentences.zh: 七年，楚使子常伐吳，吳大敗楚於豫章。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Chu sent Zi Chang to attack Wu. Wu greatly defeated Chu at Yu Zhang.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Chu sent Zi Chang to attack Wu. Wu greatly defeated Chu at Yu Zhang.

sentences.zh: 十年冬，吳王闔閭、伍子胥、伯與唐、蔡俱伐楚，楚大敗，吳兵遂入郢，辱平王之墓，以伍子胥故也。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, winter, Wu wang He Lu, Wu Zi Xu, Bai Yu, Tang, and Cai all attacked Chu. Chu was greatly defeated. Wu troops then entered Ying and humiliated Ping Wang's tomb, because of Wu Zi Xu's reason.
translations.idiomatic: In the winter of the tenth year, King He Lu of Wu, Wu Zi Xu, Bai Yu, Tang, and Cai all attacked Chu. Chu was greatly defeated. Wu troops then entered Ying and humiliated King Ping's tomb, because of Wu Zi Xu's reason.

sentences.zh: 吳兵之來，楚使子常以兵迎之，夾漢水陣。

translations.literal: When Wu troops came, Chu sent Zi Chang with troops to welcome them, arrayed flanking the Han water.
translations.idiomatic: When the Wu troops came, Chu sent Zi Chang with troops to welcome them, arrayed flanking the Han River.

sentences.zh: 吳伐敗子常，子常亡奔鄭。

translations.literal: Wu attacked and defeated Zi Chang. Zi Chang fled to Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: Wu attacked and defeated Zi Chang. Zi Chang fled to Zheng.

sentences.zh: 楚兵走，吳乘勝逐之，五戰及郢。

translations.literal: Chu troops fled. Wu rode their victory and pursued them. After five battles they reached Ying.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu troops fled. Wu rode their victory and pursued them. After five battles they reached Ying.

sentences.zh: 己卯，昭王出奔。

translations.literal: On Ji Mao, Zhao Wang fled out.
translations.idiomatic: On the Ji Mao day, King Zhao fled out.

sentences.zh: 庚辰，吳人入郢。

translations.literal: On Geng Chen, Wu people entered Ying.
translations.idiomatic: On the Geng Chen day, the Wu people entered Ying.

sentences.zh: 昭王亡也至雲夢。

translations.literal: Zhao Wang, while fleeing, arrived at Yun Meng.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao, while fleeing, arrived at Yun Meng.

sentences.zh: 雲夢不知其王也，射傷王。

translations.literal: Yun Meng did not know their wang and shot, wounding the wang.
translations.idiomatic: Yun Meng did not know their king and shot, wounding the king.

sentences.zh: 王走鄖。

translations.literal: The wang fled to Yun.
translations.idiomatic: The king fled to Yun.

sentences.zh: 鄖公之弟懷曰：「平王殺吾父，今我殺其子，不亦可乎？」

translations.literal: Yun gong younger brother Huai said: 'Ping Wang killed my father, now I kill his son, not also fitting?'
translations.idiomatic: The Yun gong's younger brother Huai said: 'King Ping killed my father. Now I kill his son. Is it not also fitting?'

sentences.zh: 鄖公止之，然恐其弒昭王，乃與王出奔隨。

translations.literal: Yun gong stopped him, but feared he would assassinate Zhao Wang. He then fled out with the wang to Sui.
translations.idiomatic: Yun gong stopped him, but feared he would assassinate King Zhao. He then fled out with the king to Sui.

sentences.zh: 吳王聞昭王往，即進擊隨，謂隨人曰：「周之子孫封於江漢之閒者，楚盡滅之。」

translations.literal: Wu wang heard Zhao Wang went, immediately advanced attacked Sui, told Sui people said: 'Zhou descendants enfeoffed between Jiang Han, Chu completely extinguished them.'
translations.idiomatic: The Wu king heard that King Zhao had gone there and immediately advanced to attack Sui. He told the Sui people, saying: 'The Zhou descendants enfeoffed between the Jiang and Han, Chu completely extinguished them.'

sentences.zh: 欲殺昭王。

translations.literal: He desired to kill Zhao Wang.
translations.idiomatic: He desired to kill King Zhao.

sentences.zh: 王從臣子綦乃深匿王，自以為王，謂隨人曰：「以我予吳。」

translations.literal: Wang follower Zi Qi then deeply hid wang, self pretended wang, told Sui people said: 'Give me to Wu.'
translations.idiomatic: The king's follower Zi Qi then deeply hid the king. He himself pretended to be the king and told the Sui people, saying: 'Give me to Wu.'

sentences.zh: 隨人卜予吳，不吉，乃謝吳王曰：「昭王亡，不在隨。」

translations.literal: Sui people divined give to Wu, not auspicious, then apologized Wu wang said: 'Zhao Wang fled, not in Sui.'
translations.idiomatic: The Sui people divined about giving him to Wu, and it was not auspicious. They then apologized to the Wu king, saying: 'King Zhao has fled and is not in Sui.'

sentences.zh: 吳請入自索之，隨不聽，吳亦罷去。

translations.literal: Wu requested to enter and search for him themselves. Sui did not listen. Wu also dismissed and departed.
translations.idiomatic: Wu requested to enter and search for him themselves. Sui did not listen. The Wu forces also dismissed and departed.

sentences.zh: 昭王之出郢也，使申鮑胥請救於秦。

translations.literal: When Zhao Wang fled Ying, he sent Shen Bao Xu to request aid from Qin.
translations.idiomatic: When King Zhao fled Ying, he sent Shen Bao Xu to request aid from the state of Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦以車五百乘救楚，楚亦收餘散兵，與秦擊吳。

translations.literal: Qin sent five hundred chariots to save Chu. Chu also gathered their remaining scattered troops and attacked Wu together with Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Qin sent five hundred chariots to save Chu. Chu also gathered their remaining scattered troops and attacked Wu together with the Qin forces.

sentences.zh: 十一年六月，敗吳於稷。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, sixth month, they defeated Wu at Ji.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month of the eleventh year, they defeated Wu at Ji.

sentences.zh: 會吳王弟夫概見吳王兵傷敗，乃亡歸，自立為王。

translations.literal: Fu Gai, the Wu wang's younger brother, saw that the Wu wang's troops were wounded and defeated. He then fled back and established himself as wang.
translations.idiomatic: Fu Gai, the Wu king's younger brother, saw that the Wu king's troops were wounded and defeated. He then fled back and established himself as king.

sentences.zh: 闔閭聞之，引兵去楚，歸擊夫概。

translations.literal: He Lu heard this and led troops to depart from Chu. He returned to attack Fu Gai.
translations.idiomatic: He Lu heard this and led troops to depart from Chu. He returned to attack Fu Gai.

sentences.zh: 夫概敗，奔楚，楚封之堂谿，號為堂谿氏。

translations.literal: Fu Gai was defeated and fled to Chu. Chu enfeoffed him at Tang Xi and called him the Tang Xi clan.
translations.idiomatic: Fu Gai was defeated and fled to Chu. Chu enfeoffed him at Tang Xi and called him the Tang Xi clan.

sentences.zh: 楚昭王滅唐九月，歸入郢。

translations.literal: Chu Zhao Wang extinguished Tang after nine months and returned to enter Ying.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao of Chu extinguished Tang after nine months and returned to enter Ying.

sentences.zh: 十二年，吳復伐楚，取番。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Wu again attacked Chu and took Fan.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Wu again attacked Chu and took Fan.

sentences.zh: 楚恐，去郢，北徙都鄀。

translations.literal: Chu feared and departed from Ying. They moved the capital north to Dui.
translations.idiomatic: Chu feared and departed from Ying. They moved the capital north to Dui.

sentences.zh: 十六年，孔子相魯。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Confucius became prime minister of Lu.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Confucius became prime minister of Lu.

sentences.zh: 二十年，楚滅頓，滅胡。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, Chu extinguished Dun and extinguished Hu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, Chu extinguished Dun and extinguished Hu.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，吳王闔閭伐越。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Wu wang He Lu attacked Yue.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, King He Lu of Wu attacked Yue.

sentences.zh: 越王句踐射傷吳王，遂死。

translations.literal: Yue wang Gou Jian shot and wounded the Wu wang, who then died.
translations.idiomatic: King Gou Jian of Yue shot and wounded the Wu king, who then died.

sentences.zh: 吳由此怨越而不西伐楚。

translations.literal: Wu therefore resented Yue and did not attack Chu to the west.
translations.idiomatic: Wu therefore resented Yue and did not attack Chu to the west.

sentences.zh: 二十七年春，吳伐陳，楚昭王救之，軍城父。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, spring, Wu attacked Chen. Chu Zhao Wang saved it and camped at Cheng Fu.
translations.idiomatic: In the spring of the twenty-seventh year, Wu attacked Chen. King Zhao of Chu saved it and camped at Cheng Fu.

sentences.zh: 十月，昭王病於軍中，有赤雲如鳥，夾日而蜚。

translations.literal: In the tenth month, Zhao Wang fell ill in the army camp. There were red clouds like a bird that flanked the sun and flew.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, King Zhao fell ill in the army camp. There were red clouds like a bird that flanked the sun and flew.

sentences.zh: 昭王問周太史，太史曰：「是害於楚王，然可移於將相。」

translations.literal: Zhao Wang asked Zhou grand astrologer, grand astrologer said: 'This harms Chu wang, however can shift to generals ministers.'
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao asked the Zhou grand astrologer, and the grand astrologer said: 'This harms the Chu king, however it can be shifted to the generals and ministers.'

sentences.zh: 將相聞是言，乃請自以身禱於神。

translations.literal: The generals and ministers heard these words and then requested to pray to the spirits with their own bodies.
translations.idiomatic: The generals and ministers heard these words and then requested to pray to the spirits with their own bodies.

sentences.zh: 昭王曰：「將相，孤之股肱也，今移禍，庸去是身乎！」

translations.literal: Zhao Wang said: 'Generals ministers, orphan's limbs, now shift calamity, how abandon these bodies!'
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao said: 'The generals and ministers are my limbs. Now to shift the calamity, how can I abandon these bodies!'

sentences.zh: 弗聽。

translations.literal: He did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: He did not listen.

sentences.zh: 卜而河為祟，大夫請禱河。

translations.literal: They divined and the River caused calamity. The grandees requested to pray to the River.
translations.idiomatic: They divined and the River caused calamity. The grandees requested to pray to the River.

sentences.zh: 昭王曰：「自吾先王受封，望不過江、漢，而河非所獲罪也。」

translations.literal: Zhao Wang said: 'Since my former wang received enfeoffment, gaze not exceeded Jiang, Han, and River not what obtained crime.'
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao said: 'Since my former king received enfeoffment, our gaze has not exceeded the Jiang and Han, and the River is not what we have offended.'

sentences.zh: 止不許。

translations.literal: He stopped and did not permit it.
translations.idiomatic: He stopped and did not permit it.

sentences.zh: 孔子在陳，聞是言，曰：「楚昭王通大道矣。

translations.literal: Confucius in Chen, heard these words, said: 'Chu Zhao Wang penetrated great way.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius was in Chen when he heard these words and said: 'King Zhao of Chu has penetrated the great way.

sentences.zh: 其不失國，宜哉！」

translations.literal: His not lose state, fitting!'
translations.idiomatic: That he did not lose the state is fitting!'

sentences.zh: 昭王病甚，乃召諸公子大夫曰：「孤不佞，再辱楚國之師，今乃得以天壽終，孤之幸也。」

translations.literal: Zhao Wang illness severe, then summoned various gong zi grandees said: 'Orphan not talented, twice humiliated Chu state troops, now able to with heaven longevity end, orphan's fortune.'
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao's illness became severe, and he then summoned the various gong zi and grandees, saying: 'This orphan is not talented and twice humiliated the Chu state's troops. Now I am able to end with heaven's longevity. This is the orphan's fortune.'

sentences.zh: 讓其弟公子申為王，不可。

translations.literal: He yielded to his younger brother Gong zi Shen to be wang, but it was not possible.
translations.idiomatic: He yielded to his younger brother Gong zi Shen to be king, but it was not possible.

sentences.zh: 又讓次弟公子結，亦不可。

translations.literal: He again yielded to his next younger brother Gong zi Jie, but it was also not possible.
translations.idiomatic: He again yielded to his next younger brother Gong zi Jie, but it was also not possible.

sentences.zh: 乃又讓次弟公子閭，五讓，乃後許為王。

translations.literal: He then again yielded to his next younger brother Gong zi Lv. After five yields, he was afterward permitted to be wang.
translations.idiomatic: He then again yielded to his next younger brother Gong zi Lv. After five yields, he was afterward permitted to be the king.

sentences.zh: 將戰，庚寅，昭王卒於軍中。

translations.literal: About to battle, on Geng Yin, Zhao Wang died in the army camp.
translations.idiomatic: About to battle, on the Geng Yin day, King Zhao died in the army camp.

sentences.zh: 子閭曰：「王病甚，捨其子讓群臣，臣所以許王，以廣王意也。

translations.literal: Zi Lv said: 'Wang illness severe, abandoned his son yielded to group ministers, minister so permitted wang, to broaden wang intent.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Lv said: 'The king's illness was severe. He abandoned his son and yielded to the group of ministers. The minister so permitted the king to broaden the king's intent.

sentences.zh: 今君王卒，臣豈敢忘君王之意乎！」

translations.literal: Now lord wang died, minister how dare forget lord wang intent!'
translations.idiomatic: Now the lord king has died. How dare the minister forget the lord king's intent!'

sentences.zh: 乃與子西、子綦謀，伏師閉涂，迎越女之子章立之，是為惠王。

translations.literal: He then planned with Zi Xi and Zi Qi. They hid troops and closed the roads. They welcomed the Yue woman's son Zhang and established him. This was Hui Wang.
translations.idiomatic: He then planned with Zi Xi and Zi Qi. They hid troops and closed the roads. They welcomed the Yue woman's son Zhang and established him. This was King Hui.

sentences.zh: 然後罷兵歸，葬昭王。

translations.literal: They then dismissed the troops and returned. They buried Zhao Wang.
translations.idiomatic: They then dismissed the troops and returned. They buried King Zhao.

sentences.zh: 惠王二年，子西召故平王太子建之子勝於吳，以為巢大夫，號曰白公。

translations.literal: In Hui Wang's second year, Zi Xi summoned the former Ping Wang crown prince Jian's son Sheng from Wu. He made him the Chao grandee and called him White Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In King Hui's second year, Zi Xi summoned the former King Ping's crown prince Jian's son Sheng from Wu. He made him the Chao grandee and called him White Gong.

sentences.zh: 白公好兵而下士，欲報仇。

translations.literal: White Gong loved troops and lowered himself to scholars. He desired to avenge.
translations.idiomatic: White Gong loved troops and lowered himself to scholars. He desired to avenge.

sentences.zh: 六年，白公請兵令尹子西伐鄭。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, White Gong requested troops from Ling Yin Zi Xi to attack Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, White Gong requested troops from Ling Yin Zi Xi to attack Zheng.

sentences.zh: 初，白公父建亡在鄭，鄭殺之，白公亡走吳，子西復召之，故以此怨鄭，欲伐之。

translations.literal: Initially, White Gong's father Jian fled and was in Zheng. Zheng killed him. White Gong fled to Wu. Zi Xi summoned him again. Therefore he resented Zheng with this and desired to attack it.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, White Gong's father Jian fled and was in Zheng. Zheng killed him. White Gong fled to Wu. Zi Xi summoned him again. Therefore he resented the state of Zheng with this and desired to attack it.

sentences.zh: 子西許而未為發兵。

translations.literal: Zi Xi permitted it but did not yet mobilize troops.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xi permitted it but did not yet mobilize troops.

sentences.zh: 八年，晉伐鄭，鄭告急楚，楚使子西救鄭，受賂而去。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Jin attacked Zheng. Zheng reported urgent to Chu. Chu sent Zi Xi to save Zheng, but he received a bribe and departed.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Jin attacked Zheng. Zheng reported urgent to Chu. Chu sent Zi Xi to save Zheng, but he received a bribe and departed.

sentences.zh: 白公勝怒，乃遂與勇力死士石乞等襲殺令尹子西、子綦於朝，因劫惠王，置之高府，欲弒之。

translations.literal: White Gong Sheng was angered. He then, with brave and strong dead soldiers like Shi Qi, surprise killed Ling Yin Zi Xi and Zi Qi at court. Therefore he kidnapped Hui Wang and placed him at the high office, desiring to assassinate him.
translations.idiomatic: White Gong Sheng was angered. He then, with brave and strong dead soldiers like Shi Qi, surprise killed Ling Yin Zi Xi and Zi Qi at court. Therefore he kidnapped King Hui and placed him at the high office, desiring to assassinate him.

sentences.zh: 惠王從者屈固負王亡走昭王夫人宮。

translations.literal: Hui Wang's follower Qu Gu carried the wang and fled to Zhao Wang's lady's palace.
translations.idiomatic: King Hui's follower Qu Gu carried the king and fled to King Zhao's lady's palace.

sentences.zh: 白公自立為王。

translations.literal: White Gong established himself as wang.
translations.idiomatic: White Gong established himself as king.

sentences.zh: 月餘，會葉公來救楚，楚惠王之徒與共攻白公，殺之。

translations.literal: More than a month later, Ye Gong came to save Chu. Chu Hui Wang's followers attacked White Gong together with him and killed him.
translations.idiomatic: More than a month later, Ye Gong came to save Chu. King Hui of Chu's followers attacked White Gong together with him and killed him.

sentences.zh: 惠王乃復位。

translations.literal: Hui Wang then restored his position.
translations.idiomatic: King Hui then restored his position.

sentences.zh: 是歲也，滅陳而縣之。

translations.literal: This year, they extinguished Chen and made it a county.
translations.idiomatic: This year, they extinguished Chen and made it a county.

sentences.zh: 十三年，吳王夫差彊，陵齊、晉，來伐楚。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Wu wang Fu Chai was strong. He overawed Qi and Jin and came to attack Chu.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, King Fu Chai of Wu was strong. He overawed Qi and Jin and came to attack Chu.

sentences.zh: 十六年，越滅吳。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Yue extinguished Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Yue extinguished Wu.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，楚滅蔡。

translations.literal: In the forty-second year, Chu extinguished Cai.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-second year, Chu extinguished Cai.

sentences.zh: 四十四年，楚滅杞。

translations.literal: In the forty-fourth year, Chu extinguished Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-fourth year, Chu extinguished Qi.

sentences.zh: 與秦平。

translations.literal: They made peace with Qin.
translations.idiomatic: They made peace with Qin.

sentences.zh: 是時越已滅吳而不能正江、淮北；

translations.literal: At this time Yue already extinguished Wu but could not control Jiang, Huai north;
translations.idiomatic: At this time Yue had already extinguished Wu but could not control the north of the Jiang and Huai;

sentences.zh: 楚東侵，廣地至泗上。

translations.literal: Chu invaded east and broadened its land to the Si upper.
translations.idiomatic: Chu invaded east and broadened its land to the upper reaches of the Si.

sentences.zh: 五十七年，惠王卒，子簡王中立。

translations.literal: In the fifty-seventh year, Hui Wang died, and his son Jian Wang Zhong was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-seventh year, King Hui died, and his son King Jian Zhong was established.

sentences.zh: 簡王元年，北伐滅莒。

translations.literal: In Jian Wang's first year, they attacked north and extinguished Ju.
translations.idiomatic: In King Jian's first year, they attacked north and extinguished Ju.

sentences.zh: 八年，魏文侯、韓武子、趙桓子始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Wei Wen Hou, Han Wu Zi, and Zhao Zhuan Zi began to be listed as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Wei Wen Hou, Han Wu Zi, and Zhao Zhuan Zi began to be listed as feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，簡王卒，子聲王當立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, Jian Wang died, and his son Sheng Wang Dang was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, King Jian died, and his son King Sheng Dang was established.

sentences.zh: 聲王六年，盜殺聲王，子悼王熊疑立。

translations.literal: In Sheng Wang's sixth year, a robber killed Sheng Wang, and his son Dao Wang Xiong Yi was established.
translations.idiomatic: In King Sheng's sixth year, a robber killed King Sheng, and his son King Dao Xiong Yi was established.

sentences.zh: 悼王二年，三晉來伐楚，至乘丘而還。

translations.literal: In Dao Wang's second year, the three Jin came to attack Chu, arrived at Cheng Qiu, and returned.
translations.idiomatic: In King Dao's second year, the three Jin came to attack Chu, arrived at Cheng Qiu, and returned.

sentences.zh: 四年，楚伐周。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Chu attacked Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Chu attacked Zhou.

sentences.zh: 鄭殺子陽。

translations.literal: Zheng killed Zi Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Zheng killed Zi Yang.

sentences.zh: 九年，伐韓，取負黍。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, they attacked Han and took Fu Shu.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, they attacked Han and took Fu Shu.

sentences.zh: 十一年，三晉伐楚，敗我大梁、榆關。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, the three Jin attacked Chu and defeated our Da Liang and Yu Guan.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, the three Jin attacked Chu and defeated our Da Liang and Yu Guan.

sentences.zh: 楚厚賂秦，與之平。

translations.literal: Chu heavily bribed Qin and made peace with them.
translations.idiomatic: Chu heavily bribed Qin and made peace with them.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，悼王卒，子肅王臧立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Dao Wang died, and his son Su Wang Zang was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, King Dao died, and his son King Su Zang was established.

sentences.zh: 肅王四年，蜀伐楚，取茲方。

translations.literal: In Su Wang's fourth year, Shu attacked Chu and took Ci Fang.
translations.idiomatic: In King Su's fourth year, Shu attacked Chu and took Ci Fang.

sentences.zh: 於是楚為捍關以距之。

translations.literal: Thereupon Chu made a defense pass to block them.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Chu made a defense pass to block them.

sentences.zh: 十年，魏取我魯陽。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Wei took our Lu Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Wei took our Lu Yang.

sentences.zh: 十一年，肅王卒，無子，立其弟熊良夫，是為宣王。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Su Wang died with no sons. They established his younger brother Xiong Liang Fu. This was Xuan Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, King Su died with no sons. They established his younger brother Xiong Liang Fu. This was King Xuan.

sentences.zh: 宣王六年，周天子賀秦獻公。

translations.literal: In Xuan Wang's sixth year, the Zhou heavenly son congratulated Qin Xian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In King Xuan's sixth year, the Zhou Son of Heaven congratulated Duke Xian of Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦始復彊，而三晉益大，魏惠王、齊威王尤彊。

translations.literal: Qin began to be strong again, and the three Jin became increasingly great. Wei Hui Wang and Qi Wei Wang were especially strong.
translations.idiomatic: Qin began to be strong again, and the three Jin became increasingly great. King Hui of Wei and King Wei of Qi were especially strong.

sentences.zh: 三十年，秦封衛鞅於商，南侵楚。

translations.literal: In the thirtieth year, Qin enfeoffed Wei Yang at Shang and invaded Chu to the south.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year, Qin enfeoffed Wei Yang at Shang and invaded Chu to the south.

sentences.zh: 是年，宣王卒，子威王熊商立。

translations.literal: This year, Xuan Wang died, and his son Wei Wang Xiong Shang was established.
translations.idiomatic: This year, King Xuan died, and his son King Wei Xiong Shang was established.

sentences.zh: 威王六年，周顯王致文武胙於秦惠王。

translations.literal: In Wei Wang's sixth year, Zhou Xian Wang presented Wen and Wu offerings to Qin Hui Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In King Wei's sixth year, King Xian of Zhou presented the Wen and Wu offerings to King Hui of Qin.

sentences.zh: 七年，齊孟嘗君父田嬰欺楚，楚威王伐齊，敗之於徐州，而令齊必逐田嬰。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Qi Meng Chang Jun's father Tian Ying deceived Chu. Chu Wei Wang attacked Qi, defeated them at Xu Zhou, and commanded that Qi must expel Tian Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Tian Ying, the father of Meng Chang Jun of Qi, deceived Chu. King Wei of Chu attacked Qi, defeated them at Xu Zhou, and commanded that Qi must expel Tian Ying.

sentences.zh: 田嬰恐，張丑偽謂楚王曰：「王所以戰勝於徐州者，田盼子不用也。

translations.literal: Tian Ying feared, Zhang Chou falsely told Chu wang said: 'Wang reason for victory at Xu Zhou was Tian Pan Zi not used.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Ying feared. Zhang Chou falsely told the Chu king, saying: 'The reason the king achieved victory at Xu Zhou was that Tian Pan Zi was not used.

sentences.zh: 盼子者，有功於國，而百姓為之用。

translations.literal: Pan Zi had merit for the state, and the common people were used for him.
translations.idiomatic: Pan Zi had merit for the state, and the common people were used for him.

sentences.zh: 嬰子弗善而用申紀。

translations.literal: Ying's son was not good and used Shen Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Ying's son was not good and used Shen Ji.

sentences.zh: 申紀者，大臣不附，百姓不為用，故王勝之也。

translations.literal: Shen Ji - ministers were not attached to him, common people were not used for him. Therefore the wang defeated him.
translations.idiomatic: As for Shen Ji, the ministers were not attached to him, and the common people were not used for him. Therefore the king defeated him.

sentences.zh: 今王逐嬰子，嬰子逐，盼子必用矣。

translations.literal: Now if the wang expels Ying's son, and Ying's son is expelled, Pan Zi will certainly be used.
translations.idiomatic: Now if the king expels Ying's son, and Ying's son is expelled, Pan Zi will certainly be used.

sentences.zh: 復搏其士卒以與王遇，必不便於王矣。」

translations.literal: Again gather their officers soldiers to meet wang, certainly inconvenient for wang.'
translations.idiomatic: If they again gather their officers and soldiers to meet the king, it will certainly be inconvenient for the king.'

sentences.zh: 楚王因弗逐也。

translations.literal: The Chu wang therefore did not expel him.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu king therefore did not expel him.

sentences.zh: 十一年，威王卒，子懷王熊槐立。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Wei Wang died, and his son Huai Wang Xiong Huai was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, King Wei died, and his son King Huai Xiong Huai was established.

sentences.zh: 魏聞楚喪，伐楚，取我陘山。

translations.literal: Wei heard of Chu's mourning and attacked Chu, taking our Xing Shan.
translations.idiomatic: Wei heard of Chu's mourning and attacked Chu, taking our Xing Shan.

sentences.zh: 懷王元年，張儀始相秦惠王。

translations.literal: In Huai Wang's first year, Zhang Yi began as prime minister to Qin Hui Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In King Huai's first year, Zhang Yi began as prime minister to King Hui of Qin.

sentences.zh: 四年，秦惠王初稱王。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Qin Hui Wang first called himself wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, King Hui of Qin first called himself king.

sentences.zh: 六年，楚使柱國昭陽將兵而攻魏，破之於襄陵，得八邑。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Chu sent Zhu Guo Zhao Yang to lead troops and attack Wei. He broke them at Xiang Ling and obtained eight towns.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Chu sent Zhu Guo Zhao Yang to lead troops and attack Wei. He broke them at Xiang Ling and obtained eight towns.

sentences.zh: 又移兵而攻齊，齊王患之。

translations.literal: He again shifted troops to attack Qi, and the Qi wang was worried.
translations.idiomatic: He again shifted troops to attack Qi, and the Qi king was worried.

sentences.zh: 陳軫適為秦使齊，齊王曰：「為之柰何？」

translations.literal: Chen Zhen just as Qin envoy Qi, Qi wang said: 'Do for it what?'
translations.idiomatic: Chen Zhen happened to be a Qin envoy to Qi. The Qi king said: 'What should we do about it?'

sentences.zh: 陳軫曰：「王勿憂，請令罷之。」

translations.literal: Chen Zhen said: 'Wang do not worry, please command stop it.'
