translations.idiomatic: Chen Zhen said: 'The king should not worry. Please allow me to command them to stop it.'

sentences.zh: 即往見昭陽軍中，曰：「願聞楚國之法，破軍殺將者何以貴之？」

translations.literal: Immediately went saw Zhao Yang army middle, said: 'Wish hear Chu state law, break army kill general how reward?'
translations.idiomatic: He immediately went to see Zhao Yang in the army camp and said: 'I wish to hear the law of Chu state. How do you reward one who breaks an army and kills a general?'

sentences.zh: 昭陽曰：「其官為上柱國，封上爵執珪。」

translations.literal: Zhao Yang said: 'His office becomes upper pillar state, enfeoffed upper rank holds jade tablet.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yang said: 'His office becomes the upper pillar state, and he is enfeoffed with the upper rank and holds a jade tablet.'

sentences.zh: 陳軫曰：「其有貴於此者乎？」

translations.literal: Chen Zhen said: 'Is there honor greater than this?'
translations.idiomatic: Chen Zhen said: 'Is there honor greater than this?'

sentences.zh: 昭陽曰：「令尹。」

translations.literal: Zhao Yang said: 'Ling Yin.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yang said: 'The Ling Yin.'

sentences.zh: 陳軫曰：「今君已為令尹矣，此國冠之上。

translations.literal: Chen Zhen said: 'Now lord already Ling Yin, this state crown above.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Zhen said: 'Now the lord is already the Ling Yin. This is above the state crown.

sentences.zh: 臣請得譬之。

translations.literal: Minister please get parable it.'
translations.idiomatic: The minister requests to use a parable for it.'

sentences.zh: 人有遺其舍人一卮酒者，舍人相謂曰：『數人飲此，不足以遍，請遂畫地為蛇，蛇先成者獨飲之。』

translations.literal: Someone left his attendants one cup wine, attendants mutually said: 'Several people drink this, not sufficient circulate, please then draw ground for snake, snake first complete alone drink it.'
translations.idiomatic: Someone left his attendants one cup of wine. The attendants said to each other: 'Several people drinking this is not sufficient to go around. Please then draw a snake on the ground, and the one whose snake is completed first will drink it alone.'

sentences.zh: 一人曰：『吾蛇先成。』

translations.literal: One person said: 'My snake first complete.'
translations.idiomatic: One person said: 'My snake is completed first.'

sentences.zh: 舉酒而起，曰：『吾能為之足。』

translations.literal: Raised wine rose, said: 'I can for it feet.'
translations.idiomatic: He raised the wine and rose, saying: 'I can add feet to it.'

sentences.zh: 及其為之足，而後成人奪之酒而飲之，曰：『蛇固無足，今為之足，是非蛇也。』

translations.literal: When reached made feet for it, then other person seized wine drank it, said: 'Snake originally no feet, now made feet for it, this not snake.'
translations.idiomatic: When he had finished making feet for it, then another person seized the wine and drank it, saying: 'A snake originally has no feet. Now that you have made feet for it, this is not a snake.'

sentences.zh: 今君相楚而攻魏，破軍殺將，功莫大焉，冠之上不可以加矣。

translations.literal: Now the lord as prime minister of Chu attacked Wei, broke the army and killed the general. No merit is greater. Nothing can be added above the crown.
translations.idiomatic: Now the lord, as prime minister of Chu, attacked Wei, broke the army and killed the general. No merit is greater. Nothing can be added above the crown.

sentences.zh: 今又移兵而攻齊，攻齊勝之，官爵不加於此；

translations.literal: Now again shift troops attack Qi, attack Qi win it, office rank not add to this;
translations.idiomatic: Now you again shift troops to attack the state of Qi. If you attack Qi and win, your office and rank will not be added to this;

sentences.zh: 攻之不勝，身死爵奪，有毀於楚：此為蛇為足之說也。

translations.literal: Attack not win, body die rank seize, have harm to Chu: this for snake make feet saying.
translations.idiomatic: if you attack and do not win, your body will die and your rank will be seized, and there will be harm to Chu. This is the saying of adding feet to a snake.

sentences.zh: 不若引兵而去以德齊，此持滿之術也。」

translations.literal: Not if lead troops depart bestow virtue Qi, this hold full technique.'
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to lead troops away and bestow virtue on Qi. This is the technique of holding what is full.'

sentences.zh: 昭陽曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Zhao Yang said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yang said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 引兵而去。

translations.literal: He led troops and departed.
translations.idiomatic: He led troops and departed.

sentences.zh: 燕、韓君初稱王。

translations.literal: The Yan and Han lords first called themselves wang.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan and Han lords first called themselves king.

sentences.zh: 秦使張儀與楚、齊、魏相會，盟齧桑。

translations.literal: Qin sent Zhang Yi to meet with Chu, Qi, and Wei. They allied at Nie Sang.
translations.idiomatic: Qin sent Zhang Yi to meet with Chu, Qi, and Wei. They formed an alliance at Nie Sang.

sentences.zh: 十一年，蘇秦約從山東六國共攻秦，楚懷王為從長。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Su Qin allied the six states east of the mountains to together attack Qin. Chu Huai Wang was the alliance leader.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Su Qin allied the six states east of the mountains to together attack Qin. King Huai of Chu was the alliance leader.

sentences.zh: 至函谷關，秦出兵擊六國，六國兵皆引而歸，齊獨後。

translations.literal: They arrived at Han Gu pass. Qin sent troops to attack the six states. The six states' troops all withdrew and returned. Qi was alone and later.
translations.idiomatic: They arrived at Han Gu pass. Qin sent troops to attack the six states. The six states' troops all withdrew and returned. Qi alone was later.

sentences.zh: 十二年，齊湣王伐敗趙、魏軍，秦亦伐敗韓，與齊爭長。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Qi Min Wang attacked and defeated the Zhao and Wei armies. Qin also attacked and defeated Han. They contended for leadership with Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, King Min of Qi attacked and defeated the Zhao and Wei armies. Qin also attacked and defeated Han. They contended for leadership with Qi.

sentences.zh: 十六年，秦欲伐齊，而楚與齊從親，秦惠王患之，乃宣言張儀免相，使張儀南見楚王，謂楚王曰：「敝邑之王所甚說者無先大王，雖儀之所甚願為門闌之廝者亦無先大王。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, Qin desired attack Qi, but Chu with Qi allied close, Qin Hui Wang worried it, then proclaimed Zhang Yi dismissed prime minister, sent Zhang Yi south saw Chu wang, told Chu wang said: 'My humble state's wang what very pleases has none before great wang, though Yi what very wishes to be gate barrier servant also none before great wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Qin desired to attack Qi, but Chu was allied closely with Qi. King Hui of Qin worried about it, then proclaimed that Zhang Yi was dismissed as prime minister, and sent Zhang Yi south to see the Chu king. He told the Chu king, saying: 'What pleases the king of my humble state most has none before the great king. Though what I most wish to be is a gate barrier servant, there is also none before the great king.

sentences.zh: 敝邑之王所甚憎者無先齊王，雖儀之所甚憎者亦無先齊王。

translations.literal: What my humble state wang hates most has none before the Qi wang. Though what I hate most also has none before the Qi wang.
translations.idiomatic: What the king of my humble state hates most has none before the Qi king. Though what I hate most also has none before the Qi king.

sentences.zh: 而大王和之，是以敝邑之王不得事王，而令儀亦不得為門闌之廝也。

translations.literal: But the great wang allies with him. Therefore my humble state wang cannot serve the wang, and causes Yi also cannot be a gate barrier servant.
translations.idiomatic: But the great king allies with him. Therefore the king of my humble state cannot serve the king, and this causes Yi also cannot be a gate barrier servant.

sentences.zh: 王為儀閉關而絕齊，今使使者從儀西取笔秦所分楚商於之地方六百里，如是則齊弱矣。

translations.literal: The wang, for Yi, closes the pass and cuts off Qi. Now sending an envoy to follow Yi west to take the brush - the land of six hundred li that Qin divided from Chu at Shang Yu. Like this, then Qi will be weak.
translations.idiomatic: The king, for Yi, closes the pass and cuts off Qi. Now send an envoy to follow Yi west to take the land of six hundred li that Qin divided from Chu at Shang Yu. Like this, then Qi will be weak.

sentences.zh: 是北弱齊，西德於秦，私商於以為富，此一計而三利俱至也。」

translations.literal: This north weakens Qi, west virtue to Qin, privately Shang Yu as wealth, this one plan three benefits all arrive.'
translations.idiomatic: This weakens Qi to the north, bestows virtue on Qin to the west, and privately makes Shang Yu wealth. This one plan brings three benefits all at once.'

sentences.zh: 懷王大悅，乃置相璽於張儀，日與置酒，宣言「吾復得吾商於之地」。

translations.literal: Huai Wang greatly pleased, then placed prime minister seal on Zhang Yi, daily with him set wine, proclaimed 'I again obtain my Shang Yu land.'
translations.idiomatic: King Huai was greatly pleased, then placed the prime minister seal on Zhang Yi, daily set wine with him, and proclaimed: 'I again obtain my Shang Yu land.'

sentences.zh: 群臣皆賀，而陳軫獨弔。

translations.literal: The group of ministers all congratulated, but Chen Zhen alone mourned.
translations.idiomatic: The group of ministers all congratulated, but Chen Zhen alone mourned.

sentences.zh: 懷王曰：「何故？」

translations.literal: Huai Wang said: 'Why?'
translations.idiomatic: King Huai said: 'What is the reason?'

sentences.zh: 陳軫對曰：「秦之所為重王者，以王之有齊也。

translations.literal: Chen Zhen answered said: 'Qin what for respects wang, because wang has Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Zhen answered, saying: 'The reason Qin respects the king is because the king has Qi.

sentences.zh: 今地未可得而齊交先絕，是楚孤也。

translations.literal: Now the land is not yet obtainable but the Qi alliance is first cut off. This makes Chu isolated.
translations.idiomatic: Now the land is not yet obtainable but the Qi alliance is first cut off. This makes Chu isolated.

sentences.zh: 夫秦又何重孤國哉，必輕楚矣。

translations.literal: Indeed, what does Qin respect about an isolated state? They will certainly slight Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, what does Qin respect about an isolated state? They will certainly slight Chu.

sentences.zh: 且先出地而後絕齊，則秦計不為。

translations.literal: Moreover, if we first give the land and then cut off Qi, then Qin's plan will not work.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, if we first give the land and then cut off Qi, then Qin's plan will not work.

sentences.zh: 先絕齊而後責地，則必見欺於張儀。

translations.literal: If we first cut off Qi and then demand the land, we will certainly be deceived by Zhang Yi.
translations.idiomatic: If we first cut off Qi and then demand the land, we will certainly be deceived by Zhang Yi.

sentences.zh: 見欺於張儀，則王必怨之。

translations.literal: Being deceived by Zhang Yi, the wang will certainly resent it.
translations.idiomatic: Being deceived by Zhang Yi, the king will certainly resent it.

sentences.zh: 怨之，是西起秦患，北絕齊交。

translations.literal: Resenting it will raise Qin calamity to the west and cut off Qi alliance to the north.
translations.idiomatic: Resenting it will raise Qin calamity to the west and cut off the Qi alliance to the north.

sentences.zh: 西起秦患，北絕齊交，則兩國之兵必至。

translations.literal: Raising Qin calamity to the west and cutting off Qi alliance to the north will cause both states' troops to certainly arrive.
translations.idiomatic: Raising Qin calamity to the west and cutting off the Qi alliance to the north will cause both states' troops to certainly arrive.

sentences.zh: 臣故弔。」

translations.literal: Minister therefore mourn.'
translations.idiomatic: The minister therefore mourns.'

sentences.zh: 楚王弗聽，因使一將軍西受封地。

translations.literal: The Chu wang did not listen. He therefore sent one general west to receive the enfeoffed land.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu king did not listen. He therefore sent one general west to receive the enfeoffed land.

sentences.zh: 張儀至秦，詳醉墜車，稱病不出三月，地不可得。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi arrived at Qin. He pretended to be drunk and fell from his chariot. He claimed illness and did not come out for three months. The land was not obtainable.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi arrived at Qin. He pretended to be drunk and fell from his chariot. He claimed illness and did not come out for three months. The land was not obtainable.

sentences.zh: 楚王曰：「儀以吾絕齊為尚薄邪？」

translations.literal: Chu wang said: 'Yi because I cut off Qi still considers thin?'
translations.idiomatic: The Chu king said: 'Does Yi still consider my cutting off Qi to be insufficient?'

sentences.zh: 乃使勇士宋遺北辱齊王。

translations.literal: He then sent the brave warrior Song Yi north to insult the Qi wang.
translations.idiomatic: He then sent the brave warrior Song Yi north to insult the Qi king.

sentences.zh: 齊王大怒，折楚符而合於秦。

translations.literal: The Qi wang was greatly angered. He broke the Chu tally and allied with Qin.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi king was greatly angered. He broke the Chu tally and allied with Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦齊交合，張儀乃起朝，謂楚將軍曰：「子何不受地？

translations.literal: Qin Qi allied, Zhang Yi then rose court, told Chu general said: 'You why not accept land?
translations.idiomatic: Qin and Qi allied. Zhang Yi then rose at court and told the Chu general, saying: 'Why do you not accept the land?

sentences.zh: 從某至某，廣袤六里。」

translations.literal: From so-and-so to so-and-so, breadth length six li.'
translations.idiomatic: From such-and-such to such-and-such, the breadth and length are six li.'

sentences.zh: 楚將軍曰：「臣之所以見命者六百里，不聞六里。」

translations.literal: Chu general said: 'Minister what received command six hundred li, not heard six li.'
translations.idiomatic: The Chu general said: 'What the minister received in command was six hundred li. I have not heard of six li.'

sentences.zh: 即以歸報懷王。

translations.literal: He immediately returned with this and reported to Huai Wang.
translations.idiomatic: He immediately returned with this and reported to King Huai.

sentences.zh: 懷王大怒，興師將伐秦。

translations.literal: Huai Wang was greatly angered. He raised troops and was about to attack Qin.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai was greatly angered. He raised troops and was about to attack Qin.

sentences.zh: 陳軫又曰：「伐秦非計也。

translations.literal: Chen Zhen again said: 'Attacking Qin not plan.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Zhen again said: 'Attacking Qin is not a plan.

sentences.zh: 不如因賂之一名都，與之伐齊，是我亡於秦，取償於齊也，吾國尚可全。

translations.literal: It would be better to bribe it with one famous city and attack Qi together with it. This way we lose to Qin but take compensation from Qi. Our state can still be preserved.
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to bribe it with one famous city and attack the state of Qi together with it. This way we lose to Qin but take compensation from Qi. Our state can still be preserved.

sentences.zh: 今王已絕於齊而責欺於秦，是吾合秦齊之交而來天下之兵也，國必大傷矣。」

translations.literal: Now wang already cut off from Qi but demand deceived by Qin, this makes us unite Qin Qi alliance and bring world's troops, state certainly greatly harmed.'
translations.idiomatic: Now the king has already cut off from Qi but demands to be deceived by Qin. This makes us unite the Qin and Qi alliance and bring the world's troops. The state will certainly be greatly harmed.'

sentences.zh: 楚王不聽，遂絕和於秦，發兵西攻秦。

translations.literal: The Chu wang did not listen. He then cut off peace with Qin and mobilized troops to attack Qin to the west.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu king did not listen. He then cut off peace with Qin and mobilized troops to attack Qin to the west.

sentences.zh: 秦亦發兵擊之。

translations.literal: Qin also mobilized troops and attacked it.
translations.idiomatic: Qin also mobilized troops and attacked it.

sentences.zh: 十七年春，與秦戰丹陽，秦大敗我軍，斬甲士八萬，虜我大將軍屈丐、裨將軍逢侯丑等七十餘人，遂取漢中之郡。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, spring, we battled with Qin at Dan Yang. Qin greatly defeated our army, beheaded eighty thousand armored soldiers, captured our grand general Qu Gai, deputy general Feng Hou Chou and more than seventy others, and then took the Han Zhong commandery.
translations.idiomatic: In the spring of the seventeenth year, we battled with Qin at Dan Yang. Qin greatly defeated our army, beheaded eighty thousand armored soldiers, captured our grand general Qu Gai, deputy general Feng Hou Chou, and more than seventy others, and then took the Han Zhong commandery.

sentences.zh: 楚懷王大怒，乃悉國兵復襲秦，戰於藍田，大敗楚軍。

translations.literal: Chu Huai Wang was greatly angered. He then sent all the state's troops to again attack Qin. They battled at Lan Tian and greatly defeated the Chu army.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai of Chu was greatly angered. He then sent all the state's troops to again attack Qin. They battled at Lan Tian, and Qin greatly defeated the Chu army.

sentences.zh: 韓、魏聞楚之困，乃南襲楚，至於鄧。

translations.literal: Han, Wei heard Chu's distress, then south attacked Chu, reached Deng.
translations.idiomatic: Han and Wei heard of Chu's distress and then attacked Chu from the south, reaching Deng.

sentences.zh: 楚聞，乃引兵歸。

translations.literal: Chu heard and then led the troops back.
translations.idiomatic: Chu heard of this and then led the troops back.

sentences.zh: 十八年，秦使使約復與楚親，分漢中之半以和楚。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Qin sent an envoy who promised to again become close with Chu and divided half of Han Zhong to make peace with Chu.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Qin sent an envoy who promised to again become close with Chu and divided half of Han Zhong to make peace with Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚王曰：「願得張儀，不願得地。」

translations.literal: Chu wang said: 'Wish obtain Zhang Yi, not wish obtain land.'
translations.idiomatic: The Chu king said: 'I wish to obtain Zhang Yi, not to obtain land.'

sentences.zh: 張儀聞之，請之楚。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi heard this and requested to go to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi heard this and requested to go to Chu.

sentences.zh: 秦王曰：「楚且甘心於子，柰何？」

translations.literal: Qin wang said: 'Chu moreover content with you, what to do?'
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king said: 'Chu is moreover content with you. What is to be done?'

sentences.zh: 張儀曰：「臣善其左右靳尚，靳尚又能得事於楚王幸姬鄭袖，袖所言無不從者。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi said: 'Minister friendly with his attendants Jin Shang, Jin Shang moreover can obtain service with Chu wang favored concubine Zheng Xiu, Xiu what said none not followed.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi said: 'The minister is friendly with his attendants Jin Shang. Jin Shang moreover can obtain service with the Chu king's favored concubine Zheng Xiu. Whatever Xiu says, none is not followed.

sentences.zh: 且儀以前使負楚以商於之約，今秦楚大戰，有惡，臣非面自謝楚不解。

translations.literal: Moreover, I previously as envoy wronged Chu with the Shang Yu agreement. Now Qin and Chu have had a great battle with enmity. I must apologize to Chu in person to resolve it.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, I previously as envoy wronged Chu with the Shang Yu agreement. Now Qin and Chu have had a great battle with enmity. I must apologize to Chu in person to resolve it.

sentences.zh: 且大王在，楚不宜敢取儀。

translations.literal: Moreover, with the great wang present, Chu would not dare to take Yi.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, with the great king present, Chu would not dare to take Yi.

sentences.zh: 誠殺儀以便國，臣之願也。」

translations.literal: Truly kill Yi to benefit state, minister's wish.'
translations.idiomatic: Truly, if killing Yi would benefit the state, that is the minister's wish.'

sentences.zh: 儀遂使楚。

translations.literal: Yi then went as envoy to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Yi then went as envoy to Chu.

sentences.zh: 至，懷王不見，因而囚張儀，欲殺之。

translations.literal: He arrived, but Huai Wang did not see him. Therefore he imprisoned Zhang Yi and desired to kill him.
translations.idiomatic: When he arrived, King Huai did not see him. Therefore, the king imprisoned Zhang Yi and desired to kill him.

sentences.zh: 儀私於靳尚，靳尚為請懷王曰：「拘張儀，秦王必怒。

translations.literal: Yi privately with Jin Shang, Jin Shang for requested Huai Wang said: 'Detain Zhang Yi, Qin wang certainly angry.
translations.idiomatic: Yi privately met with Jin Shang. Jin Shang then requested of King Huai, saying: 'If we detain Zhang Yi, the Qin king will certainly be angry.

sentences.zh: 天下見楚無秦，必輕王矣。」

translations.literal: World sees Chu without Qin, certainly slight wang.'
translations.idiomatic: If the world sees Chu without Qin, it will certainly slight the king.'

sentences.zh: 又謂夫人鄭袖曰：「秦王甚愛張儀，而王欲殺之，今將以上庸之地六縣賂楚，以美人聘楚王，以宮中善歌者為之媵。

translations.literal: Again told lady Zheng Xiu said: 'Qin wang very loves Zhang Yi, but wang desires kill him, now will with Shang Yong land six counties bribe Chu, with beauty betroth Chu wang, with palace good singers for attendants.
translations.idiomatic: He again told the lady Zheng Xiu, saying: 'The Qin king very much loves Zhang Yi, but the king desires to kill him. Now Qin will bribe Chu with the land of Shang Yong's six counties, betroth the Chu king with a beauty, and provide palace singers as attendants.

sentences.zh: 楚王重地，秦女必貴，而夫人必斥矣。

translations.literal: The Chu wang values land. The Qin woman will certainly be noble, but the lady will certainly be demoted.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu king values land. The Qin woman will certainly be noble, but the lady will certainly be demoted.

sentences.zh: 夫人不若言而出之。」

translations.literal: Lady not if speak release him.'
translations.idiomatic: It would be better for the lady to speak and have him released.'

sentences.zh: 鄭袖卒言張儀於王而出之。

translations.literal: Zheng Xiu finally spoke to the wang and had Zhang Yi released.
translations.idiomatic: Zheng Xiu finally spoke to the king and had Zhang Yi released.

sentences.zh: 儀出，懷王因善遇儀，儀因說楚王以叛從約而與秦合親，約婚姻。

translations.literal: Yi was released. Huai Wang therefore treated Yi well. Yi therefore persuaded the Chu wang to break the alliance agreement and become close with Qin, agreeing to marriage.
translations.idiomatic: Yi was released. King Huai therefore treated Yi well. Yi therefore persuaded the Chu king to break the alliance agreement and become close with Qin, agreeing to marriage.

sentences.zh: 張儀已去，屈原使從齊來，諫王曰：「何不誅張儀？」

translations.literal: Zhang Yi already departed, Qu Yuan envoy from Qi came, admonished wang said: 'Why not execute Zhang Yi?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi had already departed when Qu Yuan's envoy came from Qi and admonished the king, saying: 'Why did you not execute Zhang Yi?'

sentences.zh: 懷王悔，使人追儀，弗及。

translations.literal: Huai Wang regretted it and sent people to pursue Yi, but they did not catch him.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai regretted it and sent people to pursue Yi, but they did not catch him.

sentences.zh: 是歲，秦惠王卒。

translations.literal: This year, Qin Hui Wang died.
translations.idiomatic: This year, King Hui of Qin died.

sentences.zh: 二十［六］年，齊湣王欲為從長，惡楚之與秦合，乃使使遺楚王書曰：「寡人患楚之不察於尊名也。

translations.literal: Twenty [six] year, Qi Min Wang desired be alliance leader, hated Chu's alliance with Qin, then sent envoy sent Chu wang letter said: 'I worry Chu not discern honorable name.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-[six]th year, King Min of Qi desired to be the alliance leader and hated Chu's alliance with Qin. He then sent an envoy who delivered a letter to the Chu king, saying: 'I worry that Chu does not discern the honorable name.

sentences.zh: 今秦惠王死，武王立，張儀走魏，樗裏疾、公孫衍用，而楚事秦。

translations.literal: Now Qin Hui Wang has died and Wu Wang is established. Zhang Yi has fled to Wei. Chu Li Ji and Gong Sun Yan are employed, but Chu serves Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Now King Hui of Qin has died and King Wu is established. Zhang Yi has fled to Wei. Chu Li Ji and Gong Sun Yan are employed, but the state of Chu serves Qin.

sentences.zh: 夫樗裏疾善乎韓，而公孫衍善乎魏；

translations.literal: Indeed Chu Li Ji friendly with Han, and Gong Sun Yan friendly with Wei;
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, Chu Li Ji is friendly with the state of Han, and Gong Sun Yan is friendly with the state of Wei;

sentences.zh: 楚必事秦，韓、魏恐，必因二人求合於秦，則燕、趙亦宜事秦。

translations.literal: Chu will certainly serve Qin. Han and Wei will fear and certainly seek to unite with Qin through these two people. Then Yan and Zhao will also appropriately serve Qin.
translations.idiomatic: The state of Chu will certainly serve Qin. The states of Han and Wei will fear and certainly seek to unite with Qin through these two people. Then the states of Yan and Zhao will also appropriately serve Qin.

sentences.zh: 四國爭事秦，則楚為郡縣矣。

translations.literal: If four states contend to serve Qin, then Chu will become mere commanderies and counties.
translations.idiomatic: If four states contend to serve Qin, then Chu will become mere commanderies and counties.

sentences.zh: 王何不與寡人并力收韓、魏、燕、趙，與為從而尊周室，以案兵息民，令於天下？

translations.literal: Wang why not with I combine strength gather Han, Wei, Yan, Zhao, with them form alliance honor Zhou chamber, to quell troops rest people, command world?
translations.idiomatic: Why does the king not combine strength with me to gather Han, Wei, Yan, and Zhao, form an alliance with them to honor the Zhou chamber, quell the troops and rest the people, and command the world?

sentences.zh: 莫敢不樂聽，則王名成矣。

translations.literal: None will dare not to happily obey. Then the wang's reputation will be complete.
translations.idiomatic: None will dare not to happily obey. Then the king's reputation will be complete.

sentences.zh: 王率諸侯并伐，破秦必矣。

translations.literal: The wang leading the feudal lords in united attack will certainly break Qin.
translations.idiomatic: If the king leads the feudal lords in a united attack, he will certainly break Qin.

sentences.zh: 王取武關、蜀、漢之地，私吳、越之富而擅江海之利，韓、魏割上黨，西薄函谷，則楚之彊百萬也。

translations.literal: The wang takes the lands of Wu Guan, Shu, and Han, privately enjoys Wu and Yue's wealth and monopolizes the Jiang and Hai profits. Han and Wei cede Shang Dang, and to the west approaches Han Gu. Then Chu's strength will be a million.
translations.idiomatic: If the king takes the lands of Wu Guan, Shu, and Han, privately enjoys Wu and Yue's wealth and monopolizes the Jiang and Hai profits, and if Han and Wei cede Shang Dang and approach Han Gu to the west, then Chu's strength will be a million.

sentences.zh: 且王欺於張儀，亡地漢中，兵銼藍田，天下莫不代王懷怒。

translations.literal: Moreover the wang was deceived by Zhang Yi, lost the land of Han Zhong, troops were worn at Lan Tian. The world none do not harbor anger on the wang's behalf.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, the king was deceived by Zhang Yi, lost the land of Han Zhong, and his troops were worn at Lan Tian. The world none do not harbor anger on the king's behalf.

sentences.zh: 今乃欲先事秦！

translations.literal: Now moreover desires first serve Qin!
translations.idiomatic: Now you moreover desire to first serve Qin! This is unacceptable!

sentences.zh: 願大王孰計之。」

translations.literal: Wish great wang carefully plan it.'
translations.idiomatic: I wish the great king to carefully plan it.'

sentences.zh: 楚王業已欲和於秦，見齊王書，猶豫不決，下其議群臣。

translations.literal: The Chu wang already desired peace with Qin. He saw the Qi wang's letter and hesitated undecided. He put it to the group of ministers to discuss.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu king already desired peace with Qin. He saw the Qi king's letter and hesitated undecided. He put it to the group of ministers to discuss.

sentences.zh: 群臣或言和秦，或曰聽齊。

translations.literal: The group of ministers some said to make peace with Qin, others said to listen to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: The group of ministers, some said to make peace with Qin, others said to listen to Qi.

sentences.zh: 昭雎曰：「王雖東取地於越，不足以刷恥；

translations.literal: Zhao Ju said: 'Wang though east take land from Yue, not sufficient wash shame;
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Ju said: 'Though the king takes land from Yue to the east, it is not sufficient to wash away the shame;

sentences.zh: 必且取地於秦，而後足以刷恥於諸侯。

translations.literal: He must moreover take land from Qin, and only then will it be sufficient to wash shame before the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: He must moreover take land from Qin, and only then will it be sufficient to wash away the shame before the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 王不如深善齊、韓以重樗裏疾，如是則王得韓、齊之重以求地矣。

translations.literal: The wang should deeply befriend Qi and Han to give weight to Chu Li Ji. Like this, the wang will obtain Han and Qi's importance to seek land.
translations.idiomatic: The king should deeply befriend Qi and Han to give weight to Chu Li Ji. Like this, the king will obtain Han and Qi's importance to seek land.

sentences.zh: 秦破韓宜陽，而韓猶復事秦者，以先王墓在平陽，而秦之武遂去之七十里，以故尤畏秦。

translations.literal: Qin broke Han's Yi Yang, but Han still again served Qin because their former wang's tombs were in Ping Yang, and Qin's Wu Sui was only seventy li distant. Therefore they especially feared Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Qin broke Han's Yi Yang, but the state of Han still again served Qin because their former king's tombs were in Ping Yang, and Qin's Wu Sui was only seventy li distant. Therefore they especially feared Qin.

sentences.zh: 不然，秦攻三川，趙攻上黨，楚攻河外，韓必亡。

translations.literal: Not so. If Qin attacks San Chuan, Zhao attacks Shang Dang, and Chu attacks He Wai, Han will certainly perish.
translations.idiomatic: Not so. If Qin attacks San Chuan, Zhao attacks Shang Dang, and Chu attacks He Wai, the state of Han will certainly perish.

sentences.zh: 楚之救韓，不能使韓不亡，然存韓者楚也。

translations.literal: Chu's saving of Han cannot make Han not perish, however the one who preserves Han is Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Chu's saving of Han cannot make Han not perish, however the one who preserves Han is Chu.

sentences.zh: 韓已得武遂於秦，以河山為塞，所報德莫如楚厚，臣以為其事王必疾。

translations.literal: Han has already obtained Wu Sui from Qin, using river and mountains as a barrier. What repays virtue is none thicker than Chu. The minister thinks they will serve the wang certainly quickly.
translations.idiomatic: Han has already obtained Wu Sui from Qin, using river and mountains as a barrier. What repays virtue is none thicker than Chu. The minister thinks they will serve the king certainly quickly.

sentences.zh: 齊之所信於韓者，以韓公子眛為齊相也。

translations.literal: What Qi is trusted by Han is because Han gong zi Mei serves as Qi's prime minister.
translations.idiomatic: The reason Qi is trusted by Han is because Han's Gong zi Mei serves as Qi's prime minister.

sentences.zh: 韓已得武遂於秦，王甚善之，使之以齊、韓重樗裏疾，疾得齊、韓之重，其主弗敢棄疾也。

translations.literal: Han has already obtained Wu Sui from Qin. The wang very befriended it and sent it with Qi and Han's weight to Chu Li Ji. Ji obtained Qi and Han's weight. His master does not dare abandon Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Han has already obtained Wu Sui from Qin. The king very much befriended it and sent it with Qi and Han's weight to Chu Li Ji. Ji obtained Qi and Han's weight. His master does not dare abandon Ji.

sentences.zh: 今又益之以楚之重，樗里子必言秦，復與楚之侵地矣。」

translations.literal: Now again increase with Chu weight, Chu Li Zi certainly speak Qin, again give Chu invaded lands.'
translations.idiomatic: Now if we again increase it with Chu's weight, Chu Li Zi will certainly speak to Qin and again give Chu the invaded lands.'

sentences.zh: 於是懷王許之，竟不合秦，而合齊以善韓。

translations.literal: Thereupon Huai Wang permitted it. He finally did not ally with Qin, but allied with Qi to befriend Han.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon King Huai permitted it. He finally did not ally with the state of Qin, but allied with the state of Qi to befriend the state of Han.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，倍齊而合秦。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, he betrayed Qi and allied with Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, he betrayed Qi and allied with Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦昭王初立，乃厚賂於楚。

translations.literal: Qin Zhao Wang was first established and then heavily bribed Chu.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao of Qin was first established and then heavily bribed Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚往迎婦。

translations.literal: Chu went to welcome the bride.
translations.idiomatic: Chu went to welcome the bride.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，懷王入與秦昭王盟，約於黃棘。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Huai Wang entered and allied with Qin Zhao Wang, with the agreement at Huang Ji.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, King Huai entered and allied with King Zhao of Qin, with the agreement at Huang Ji.

sentences.zh: 秦復與楚上庸。

translations.literal: Qin again gave Shang Yong to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Qin again gave Shang Yong to Chu.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，齊、韓、魏為楚負其從親而合於秦，三國共伐楚。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, Qi, Han, and Wei, because Chu betrayed the alliance's closeness and allied with Qin, the three states together attacked Chu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, because Chu betrayed the alliance's closeness and allied with Qin, the three states of Qi, Han, and Wei together attacked Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚使太子入質於秦而請救。

translations.literal: Chu sent the crown prince to enter as hostage in Qin and requested aid.
translations.idiomatic: Chu sent the crown prince to enter as hostage in Qin and requested aid.

sentences.zh: 秦乃遣客卿通將兵救楚，三國引兵去。

translations.literal: Qin then sent guest minister Tong to lead troops and save Chu. The three states withdrew their troops and departed.
translations.idiomatic: Qin then sent guest minister Tong to lead troops and save Chu. The three states withdrew their troops and departed.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，秦大夫有私與楚太子鬬，楚太子殺之而亡歸。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, a Qin grandee privately fought with the Chu crown prince. The Chu crown prince killed him and fled back.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, a Qin grandee privately fought with the Chu crown prince. The Chu crown prince killed him and fled back.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，秦乃與齊、韓、魏共攻楚，殺楚將唐眛，取我重丘而去。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, Qin then together with Qi, Han, and Wei attacked Chu. They killed Chu general Tang Mei, took our Chong Qiu, and departed.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Qin then together with Qi, Han, and Wei attacked Chu. They killed the Chu general Tang Mei, took our Chong Qiu, and departed.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，秦復攻楚，大破楚，楚軍死者二萬，殺我將軍景缺。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Qin again attacked Chu and greatly broke Chu. Twenty thousand of the Chu army died. They killed our general Jing Que.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Qin again attacked Chu and greatly broke Chu. Twenty thousand of the Chu army died. They killed our general Jing Que.

sentences.zh: 懷王恐，乃使太子為質於齊以求平。

translations.literal: Huai Wang feared and then sent the crown prince as hostage to Qi to seek peace.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai feared and then sent the crown prince as hostage to Qi to seek peace.

sentences.zh: 三十年，秦復伐楚，取八城。

translations.literal: In the thirtieth year, Qin again attacked Chu and took eight cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year, Qin again attacked Chu and took eight cities.

sentences.zh: 秦昭王遺楚王書曰：「始寡人與王約為弟兄，盟于黃棘，太子為質，至驩也。

translations.literal: Qin Zhao Wang sent Chu wang letter said: 'Beginning I with wang agreed be brothers, allied at Huang Ji, crown prince as hostage, arrived harmony.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao of Qin sent the Chu king a letter, saying: 'At the beginning, I and the king agreed to be brothers, allied at Huang Ji, with the crown prince as hostage, and we arrived at harmony.

sentences.zh: 太子陵殺寡人之重臣，不謝而亡去，寡人誠不勝怒，使兵侵君王之邊。

translations.literal: The crown prince insulted and killed my important minister. He did not apologize and fled away. I truly cannot bear the anger and sent troops to invade the lord wang's borders.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince insulted and killed my important minister. He did not apologize and fled away. I truly cannot bear the anger and sent troops to invade the lord king's borders.

sentences.zh: 今聞君王乃令太子質於齊以求平。

translations.literal: Now I hear that the lord wang has commanded the crown prince to be hostage in Qi to seek peace.
translations.idiomatic: Now I hear that the lord king has commanded the crown prince to be hostage in Qi to seek peace.

sentences.zh: 寡人與楚接境壤界，故為婚姻，所從相親久矣。

translations.literal: I connect borders and territories with Chu. Therefore we made marriage alliances. What we followed has been mutually close for a long time.
translations.idiomatic: I connect borders and territories with Chu. Therefore we made marriage alliances. What we followed has been mutually close for a long time.

sentences.zh: 而今秦楚不驩，則無以令諸侯。

translations.literal: But now Qin and Chu are not harmonious. Then there is no way to command the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: But now Qin and Chu are not harmonious. Then there is no way to command the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 寡人願與君王會武關，面相約，結盟而去，寡人之願也。

translations.literal: I wish to meet with the lord wang at Wu Guan, face to face agree, form an alliance and depart. This is my wish.
translations.idiomatic: I wish to meet with the lord king at Wu Guan, face to face agree, form an alliance and depart. This is my wish.

sentences.zh: 敢以聞下執事。」

translations.literal: Dare to inform lower servants.'
translations.idiomatic: I dare to inform your lower servants.'

sentences.zh: 楚懷王見秦王書，患之。

translations.literal: Chu Huai Wang saw the Qin wang's letter and was worried by it.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai of Chu saw the Qin king's letter and was worried by it.

sentences.zh: 欲往，恐見欺；

translations.literal: Desired go, feared be deceived;
translations.idiomatic: He desired to go but feared to be deceived;

sentences.zh: 無往，恐秦怒。

translations.literal: Not going, he feared Qin's anger.
translations.idiomatic: If he did not go, he feared Qin's anger.

sentences.zh: 昭雎曰：「王毋行，而發兵自守耳。

translations.literal: Zhao Ju said: 'Wang do not go, but mobilize troops self defend.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Ju said: 'The king should not go, but mobilize troops to defend yourself.

sentences.zh: 秦虎狼，不可信，有并諸侯之心。」

translations.literal: Qin tiger wolf, cannot trust, has annex feudal lords heart.'
translations.idiomatic: Qin is a tiger and wolf. It cannot be trusted. It has the heart to annex the feudal lords.'

sentences.zh: 懷王子子蘭勸王行，曰：「柰何絕秦之驩心！」

translations.literal: Huai Wang son Zi Lan urged wang go, said: 'How cut off Qin harmonious heart!'
translations.idiomatic: King Huai's son Zi Lan urged the king to go, saying: 'How can we cut off Qin's harmonious heart!'

sentences.zh: 於是往會秦昭王。

translations.literal: Thereupon he went to meet Qin Zhao Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he went to meet King Zhao of Qin.

sentences.zh: 昭王詐令一將軍伏兵武關，號為秦王。

translations.literal: Zhao Wang deceived and commanded one general to hide troops at Wu Guan, calling himself Qin wang.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao deceived and commanded one general to hide troops at Wu Guan, calling himself the Qin king.

sentences.zh: 楚王至，則閉武關，遂與西至咸陽，朝章臺，如蕃臣，不與亢禮。

translations.literal: The Chu wang arrived. They then closed Wu Guan and proceeded west to Xian Yang. He attended at Zhang Tai like a vassal minister and was not given equal ceremony.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu king arrived. They then closed Wu Guan and proceeded west to Xian Yang. He attended at Zhang Tai like a vassal minister and was not given equal ceremony.

sentences.zh: 楚懷王大怒，悔不用昭子言。

translations.literal: Chu Huai Wang was greatly angered and regretted not using Zhao Zi's words.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai of Chu was greatly angered and regretted not using Zhao Zi's words.

sentences.zh: 秦因留楚王，要以割巫、黔中之郡。

translations.literal: Qin therefore detained the Chu wang and demanded the cession of the Wu and Qian Zhong commanderies.
translations.idiomatic: Qin therefore detained the Chu king and demanded the cession of the Wu and Qian Zhong commanderies.

sentences.zh: 楚王欲盟，秦欲先得地。

translations.literal: The Chu wang desired an alliance. Qin desired to first obtain the land.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu king desired an alliance. Qin desired to first obtain the land.

sentences.zh: 楚王怒曰：「秦詐我而又彊要我以地！」

translations.literal: Chu wang angered said: 'Qin deceived me and moreover strongly demanded land from me!'
translations.idiomatic: The Chu king was angered and said: 'Qin deceived me and moreover strongly demanded land from me!'

sentences.zh: 不復許秦。

translations.literal: He no longer permitted Qin.
translations.idiomatic: He no longer permitted Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦因留之。

translations.literal: Qin therefore detained him.
translations.idiomatic: Qin therefore detained him.

sentences.zh: 楚大臣患之，乃相與謀曰：「吾王在秦不得還，要以割地，而太子為質於齊，齊、秦合謀，則楚無國矣。」

translations.literal: Chu ministers worried it, then mutually planned said: 'Our wang in Qin cannot return, demands with cede land, but crown prince as hostage Qi, Qi, Qin combine plot, then Chu no state.'
translations.idiomatic: The Chu ministers worried about it and then mutually planned, saying: 'Our king in Qin cannot return and demands the cession of land, but the crown prince is hostage in Qi. If Qi and Qin combine in a plot, then Chu will have no state.'

sentences.zh: 乃欲立懷王子在國者。

translations.literal: They then desired to establish a son of Huai Wang who was in the state.
translations.idiomatic: They then desired to establish a son of King Huai who was in the state.

sentences.zh: 昭雎曰：「王與太子俱困於諸侯，而今又倍王命而立其庶子，不宜。」

translations.literal: Zhao Ju said: 'Wang and crown prince both distressed by feudal lords, but now again betray wang command establish his concubine son, not proper.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Ju said: 'The king and crown prince are both distressed by the feudal lords, but now we again betray the king's command and establish his concubine son. This is not proper.'

sentences.zh: 乃詐赴於齊，齊湣王謂其相曰：「不若留太子以求楚之淮北。」

translations.literal: Then deceived announced to Qi, Qi Min Wang told his prime minister said: 'Not if detain crown prince to seek Chu Huai Bei.'
translations.idiomatic: They then deceptively announced to Qi. King Min of Qi told his prime minister, saying: 'It would be better to detain the crown prince to seek Chu's Huai Bei.'

sentences.zh: 相曰：「不可，郢中立王，是吾抱空質而行不義於天下也。」

translations.literal: Prime minister said: 'Not possible, Ying middle established wang, this we hold empty hostage practice unrighteousness world.'
translations.idiomatic: The prime minister said: 'It is not possible. If Ying has established a king, this means we hold an empty hostage and practice unrighteousness in the world.'

sentences.zh: 或曰：「不然。

translations.literal: Some said: 'Not so.
translations.idiomatic: Some said: 'Not so.

sentences.zh: 郢中立王，因與其新王市曰『予我下東國，吾為王殺太子，不然，將與三國共立之』，然則東國必可得矣。」

translations.literal: Ying middle established wang, then with their new wang bargain said 'give me lower east state, I for wang kill crown prince, not so, will with three states together establish him', then east state certainly obtainable.'
translations.idiomatic: If Ying has established a king, then we can bargain with their new king, saying: 'Give me the lower eastern state, and I will kill the crown prince for the king. Otherwise, I will together with the three states establish him.' Then the eastern state will certainly be obtainable.'

sentences.zh: 齊王卒用其相計而歸楚太子。

translations.literal: Qi wang finally used his prime minister's plan and returned the Chu crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi king finally used his prime minister's plan and returned the Chu crown prince.

sentences.zh: 太子橫至，立為王，是為頃襄王。

translations.literal: Crown prince Heng arrived and was established as wang. This was Qing Xiang Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Crown prince Heng arrived and was established as king. This was King Qing Xiang.

sentences.zh: 乃告于秦曰：「賴社稷神靈，國有王矣。」

translations.literal: Then informed Qin said: 'Rely altars soil spirits, state has wang.'
translations.idiomatic: They then informed Qin, saying: 'Relying on the altars of soil and spirits, the state has a king.'

sentences.zh: 頃襄王橫元年，秦要懷王不可得地，楚立王以應秦，秦昭王怒，發兵出武關攻楚，大敗楚軍，斬首五萬，取析十五城而去。

translations.literal: In Qing Xiang Wang Heng's first year, Qin demanded that Huai Wang give land but could not obtain it. Chu established a wang to respond to Qin. Qin Zhao Wang was angered and mobilized troops out of Wu Guan to attack Chu. He greatly defeated the Chu army, beheaded fifty thousand heads, took Xi's fifteen cities, and departed.
translations.idiomatic: In King Qing Xiang Heng's first year, Qin demanded that King Huai give land but could not obtain it. Chu established a king to respond to Qin. King Zhao of Qin was angered and mobilized troops out of Wu Guan to attack Chu. He greatly defeated the Chu army, beheaded fifty thousand, took Xi's fifteen cities, and departed.

sentences.zh: 二年，楚懷王亡逃歸，秦覺之，遮楚道，懷王恐，乃從閒道走趙以求歸。

translations.literal: In the second year, Chu Huai Wang fled and escaped to return. Qin became aware and blocked the Chu road. Huai Wang feared and then fled to Zhao by a byway to seek return.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, King Huai of Chu fled and escaped to return. Qin became aware and blocked the Chu road. King Huai feared and then fled to Zhao by a byway to seek return.

sentences.zh: 趙主父在代，其子惠王初立，行王事，恐，不敢入楚王。

translations.literal: Zhao Zhu Fu was in Dai. His son Hui Wang had first been established and was conducting wang affairs. He feared and did not dare receive the Chu wang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Zhu Fu was in Dai. His son King Hui had first been established and was conducting king affairs. He feared and did not dare receive the Chu king.

sentences.zh: 楚王欲走魏，秦追至，遂與秦使復之秦。

translations.literal: The Chu wang desired to flee to Wei. Qin pursued and reached him. He then went with the Qin envoy again to Qin.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu king desired to flee to Wei. Qin pursued and reached him. He then went with the Qin envoy again to Qin.

sentences.zh: 懷王遂發病。

translations.literal: Huai Wang then fell ill.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai then fell ill.

sentences.zh: 頃襄王三年，懷王卒于秦，秦歸其喪于楚。

translations.literal: In Qing Xiang Wang's third year, Huai Wang died in Qin. Qin returned his funeral to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: In King Qing Xiang's third year, King Huai died in Qin. Qin returned his funeral to the state of Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚人皆憐之，如悲親戚。

translations.literal: All Chu people pitied him, like grieving relatives.
translations.idiomatic: All Chu people pitied him, like grieving relatives.

sentences.zh: 諸侯由是不直秦。

translations.literal: The feudal lords therefore did not consider Qin upright.
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords therefore did not consider Qin upright.

sentences.zh: 秦楚絕。

translations.literal: Qin and Chu cut off relations.
translations.idiomatic: Qin and Chu cut off relations.

sentences.zh: 六年，秦使白起伐韓於伊闕，大勝，斬首二十四萬。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Qin sent Bai Qi to attack Han at Yi Que. He was greatly victorious and beheaded twenty-four thousand heads.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Qin sent Bai Qi to attack Han at Yi Que. He was greatly victorious and beheaded twenty-four thousand.

sentences.zh: 秦乃遺楚王書曰：「楚倍秦，秦且率諸侯伐楚，爭一旦之命。

translations.literal: Qin then sent Chu wang letter said: 'Chu betrayed Qin, Qin moreover will lead feudal lords attack Chu, contend one morning fate.
translations.idiomatic: Qin then sent the Chu king a letter, saying: 'Chu betrayed Qin. Qin moreover will lead the feudal lords to attack Chu and contend for one morning's fate.

sentences.zh: 願王之飭士卒，得一樂戰。」

translations.literal: Wish wang prepare soldiers, obtain one happy battle.'
translations.idiomatic: I wish the king to prepare the soldiers and obtain one happy battle.'

sentences.zh: 楚頃襄王患之，乃謀復與秦平。

translations.literal: Chu Qing Xiang Wang was worried by it and then planned to make peace with Qin again.
translations.idiomatic: King Qing Xiang of Chu was worried by it and then planned to make peace with Qin again.

sentences.zh: 七年，楚迎婦於秦，秦楚復平。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Chu welcomed a bride from Qin. Qin and Chu were at peace again.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Chu welcomed a bride from Qin. Qin and Chu were at peace again.

sentences.zh: 十一年，齊秦各自稱為帝；

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Qi Qin each self called emperor;
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Qi and Qin each called themselves emperor;

sentences.zh: 月餘，復歸帝為王。

translations.literal: After more than a month, they again returned from emperor to wang.
translations.idiomatic: After more than a month, they again returned from emperor to king.

sentences.zh: 十四年，楚頃襄王與秦昭王好會于宛，結和親。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Chu Qing Xiang Wang and Qin Zhao Wang had a friendly meeting at Wan and formed a peace marriage alliance.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, King Qing Xiang of Chu and King Zhao of Qin had a friendly meeting at Wan and formed a peace marriage alliance.

sentences.zh: 十五年，楚王與秦、三晉、燕共伐齊，取淮北。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, the Chu wang together with Qin, the three Jin, and Yan attacked Qi and took Huai Bei.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, the Chu king together with Qin, the three Jin, and Yan attacked Qi and took Huai Bei.

sentences.zh: 十六年，與秦昭王好會於鄢。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, he had a friendly meeting with Qin Zhao Wang at Yan.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, he had a friendly meeting with King Zhao of Qin at Yan.

sentences.zh: 其秋，復與秦王會穰。

translations.literal: That autumn, he again met with the Qin wang at Rang.
translations.idiomatic: That autumn, he again met with the Qin king at Rang.

sentences.zh: 十八年，楚人有好以弱弓微繳加歸鴈之上者，頃襄王聞，召而問之。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, there was a Chu person who enjoyed using a weak bow with slight string to add to returning geese above. Qing Xiang Wang heard of it and summoned him to question.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, there was a Chu person who enjoyed using a weak bow with slight string to add to returning geese above. King Qing Xiang heard of it and summoned him to question.

sentences.zh: 對曰：「小臣之好射鶀鴈，羅鸗，小矢之發也，何足為大王道也。

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Small minister hobby shoot wild geese, net ducks, small arrow release, what sufficient for great wang speak.
translations.idiomatic: He replied, saying: 'The small minister's hobby of shooting wild geese and netting ducks with small arrow releases, what is sufficient for the great king to speak of?

sentences.zh: 且稱楚之大，因大王之賢，所弋非直此也。

translations.literal: Moreover, praising Chu's greatness and because of the great wang's virtue, what is hunted is not just this.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, praising Chu's greatness and because of the great king's virtue, what is hunted is not just this.

sentences.zh: 昔者三王以弋道德，五霸以弋戰國。

translations.literal: Formerly the three wang hunted with morality and virtue, the five hegemons hunted with the warring states.
translations.idiomatic: Formerly the three kings hunted with morality and virtue, the five hegemons hunted with the warring states.

sentences.zh: 故秦、魏、燕、趙者，鶀鴈也；

translations.literal: Therefore Qin, Wei, Yan, Zhao, wild geese;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Qin, Wei, Yan, and Zhao are wild geese;

sentences.zh: 齊、魯、韓、衛者，青首也；

translations.literal: Qi, Lu, Han, Wei, green heads;
translations.idiomatic: Qi, Lu, Han, and Wei are green heads;

sentences.zh: 騶、費、郯、邳者，羅鸗也。

translations.literal: Zou, Fei, Tan, and Pi are net ducks.
translations.idiomatic: Zou, Fei, Tan, and Pi are net ducks.

sentences.zh: 外其餘則不足射者。

translations.literal: Besides these, the remaining are not worth shooting.
translations.idiomatic: Besides these, the remaining are not worth shooting.

sentences.zh: 見鳥六雙，以王何取？

translations.literal: See birds six pairs, with wang what take?
translations.idiomatic: I see six pairs of birds. What will the king take?

sentences.zh: 王何不以聖人為弓，以勇士為繳，時張而射之？

translations.literal: Wang why not with sage as bow, brave warriors as string, timely draw shoot them?
translations.idiomatic: Why does the king not use sages as the bow and brave warriors as the string, and timely draw and shoot them?

sentences.zh: 此六雙者，可得而囊載也。

translations.literal: These six pairs can be obtained and carried in bags.
translations.idiomatic: These six pairs can be obtained and carried in bags.

sentences.zh: 其樂非特朝昔之樂也，其獲非特鳧鴈之實也。

translations.literal: Its joy is not just morning and evening joy, its gain is not just ducks and geese substance.
translations.idiomatic: Its joy is not just the joy of morning and evening, its gain is not just the substance of ducks and geese.

sentences.zh: 王朝張弓而射魏之大梁之南，加其右臂而徑屬之於韓，則中國之路絕而上蔡之郡壞矣。

translations.literal: The wang in the morning draws his bow and shoots south of Wei's Da Liang, adds to its right arm and directly attaches it to Han. Then the Central Plains road is cut off and Shang Cai's commandery is ruined.
translations.idiomatic: The king in the morning draws his bow and shoots south of Wei's Da Liang, adds to its right arm and directly attaches it to Han. Then the Central Plains road is cut off and Shang Cai's commandery is ruined.

sentences.zh: 還射圉之東，解魏左肘而外擊定陶，則魏之東外棄而大宋、方與二郡者舉矣。

translations.literal: Returning to shoot east of Yu, loosening Wei's left elbow and outward striking Ding Tao, then Wei's east outside is abandoned and the two commanderies of Da Song and Fang Yu are raised.
translations.idiomatic: Returning to shoot east of Yu, loosening Wei's left elbow and outward striking Ding Tao, then Wei's east outside is abandoned and the two commanderies of Da Song and Fang Yu are raised.

sentences.zh: 且魏斷二臂，顛越矣；

translations.literal: Moreover Wei cut two arms, overturned;
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, if Wei's two arms are cut, it will be overturned;

sentences.zh: 膺擊郯國，大梁可得而有也。

translations.literal: Striking Tan state chest-wise, Da Liang can be obtained and possessed.
translations.idiomatic: Striking the Tan state chest-wise, Da Liang can be obtained and possessed.

sentences.zh: 王綪繳蘭臺，飲馬西河，定魏大梁，此一發之樂也。

translations.literal: The wang draws his string at Lan Tai, drinks his horse at Xi He, settles Wei's Da Liang. This is the joy of one shot.
translations.idiomatic: The king draws his string at Lan Tai, waters his horse at Xi He, and settles Wei's Da Liang. This is the joy of one shot.

sentences.zh: 若王之於弋誠好而不厭，則出寶弓，碆新繳，射噣鳥於東海，還蓋長城以為防，朝射東莒，夕發浿丘，夜加即墨，顧據午道，則長城之東收而太山之北舉矣。

translations.literal: If the wang sincerely enjoys hunting and is not weary, then take the precious bow, sharpen the new string, shoot big birds at the East Sea, return and cover the Long Wall as defense. Morning shoot East Ju, evening shoot Pei Qiu, night add Ji Mo, look back and occupy Wu Dao. Then the east of the Long Wall is collected and the north of Tai Shan is raised.
translations.idiomatic: If the king sincerely enjoys hunting and is not weary, then take the precious bow, sharpen the new string, shoot big birds at the East Sea, return and cover the Long Wall as defense. Morning shoot East Ju, evening shoot Pei Qiu, night add Ji Mo, look back and occupy Wu Dao. Then the east of the Long Wall is collected and the north of Tai Shan is raised.

sentences.zh: 西結境於趙而北達於燕，三國布鶴，則從不待約而可成也。

translations.literal: West connecting borders with Zhao and north reaching Yan, the three states spread like cranes. Then the alliance can be completed without waiting for agreement.
translations.idiomatic: West connecting borders with Zhao and north reaching Yan, the three states spread like cranes. Then the alliance can be completed without waiting for agreement.

sentences.zh: 北遊目於燕之遼東而南登望於越之會稽，此再發之樂也。

translations.literal: North roaming the eyes at Yan's Liao Dong and south climbing to view Yue's Kui Ji, this is the joy of the second shot.
translations.idiomatic: North roaming the eyes at Yan's Liao Dong and south climbing to view Yue's Kui Ji, this is the joy of the second shot.

sentences.zh: 若夫泗上十二諸侯，左縈而右拂之，可一旦而盡也。

translations.literal: As for the twelve feudal lords on the Si, entwining left and sweeping right, they can be exhausted in one morning.
translations.idiomatic: As for the twelve feudal lords on the Si, entwining left and sweeping right, they can be exhausted in one morning.

sentences.zh: 今秦破韓以為長憂，得列城而不敢守也；

translations.literal: Now Qin broke Han as long worry, obtained row cities not dare guard;
translations.idiomatic: Now Qin broke Han as a long worry and obtained row cities but did not dare guard them;

sentences.zh: 伐魏而無功，擊趙而顧病，則秦魏之勇力屈矣，楚之故地漢中、析、酈可得而復有也。

translations.literal: Attacking Wei without merit, striking Zhao and looking back ill, then Qin and Wei's brave strength is bent. Chu's old lands of Han Zhong, Xi, and Li can be obtained and possessed again.
translations.idiomatic: Attacking the state of Wei without merit and striking the state of Zhao and looking back ill, then Qin and Wei's brave strength is bent. Chu's old lands of Han Zhong, Xi, and Li can be obtained and possessed again.

sentences.zh: 王出寶弓，碆新繳，涉鄳塞，而待秦之倦也，山東、河內可得而一也。

translations.literal: The wang takes the precious bow, sharpens the new string, fords the Meng barrier, and waits for Qin to weary. Then Shan Dong and He Nei can be obtained and united.
translations.idiomatic: The king takes the precious bow, sharpens the new string, fords the Meng barrier, and waits for Qin to weary. Then Shan Dong and He Nei can be obtained and united.

sentences.zh: 勞民休眾，南面稱王矣。

translations.literal: Labor the people and rest the masses, face south and be called wang.
translations.idiomatic: Labor the people and rest the masses, face south and be called king.

sentences.zh: 故曰秦為大鳥，負海內而處，東面而立，左臂據趙之西南，右臂傅楚鄢郢，膺擊韓魏，垂頭中國，處既形便，勢有地利，奮翼鼓鶴，方三千里，則秦未可得獨招而夜射也。」

translations.literal: Therefore said Qin as great bird, bear all under heaven reside, east face stand, left arm occupy Zhao southwest, right arm attach Chu Yan Ying, chest strike Han Wei, hang head Central Plains, place already form convenient, situation has land profit, rouse wings beat crane, square three thousand li, then Qin not can obtain alone beckon night shoot.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore it is said that Qin is a great bird, bearing all under heaven and residing, facing east and standing, left arm occupying Zhao's southwest, right arm attaching to Chu's Yan Ying, chest striking Han and Wei, hanging head over the Central Plains. Its place already has convenient form, its situation has land profit. It rouses wings and beats like a crane, square three thousand li. Then Qin cannot be obtained alone by beckoning and shooting at night.'

sentences.zh: 欲以激怒襄王，故對以此言。

translations.literal: He desired to anger Xiang Wang, therefore replied with these words.
translations.idiomatic: He desired to anger King Xiang, therefore replied with these words.

sentences.zh: 襄王因召與語，遂言曰：「夫先王為秦所欺而客死於外，怨莫大焉。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang therefore summoned spoke with, then said: 'Indeed former wang by Qin deceived guest died outside, resentment none greater.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang therefore summoned him and spoke with him, then said: 'Indeed, the former king was deceived by Qin and died as a guest outside. There is no resentment greater than this.

sentences.zh: 今以匹夫有怨，尚有報萬乘，白公、子胥是也。

translations.literal: Now with a commoner having resentment, there is still repaying ten thousand chariots. Bai Gong and Zi Xu are examples.
translations.idiomatic: Now with a commoner having resentment, there is still repaying ten thousand chariots. Bai Gong and Zi Xu are examples.

sentences.zh: 今楚之地方五千里，帶甲百萬，猶足以踴躍中野也，而坐受困，臣竊為大王弗取也。」

translations.literal: Now Chu territory five thousand li, armored one hundred thousand, still sufficient leap middle field, but sit receive distress, minister secretly for great wang not take.'
translations.idiomatic: Now Chu's territory is five thousand li, with armored troops of one hundred thousand. It is still sufficient to leap in the middle field, but to sit and receive distress, the minister secretly thinks the great king should not take this.'

sentences.zh: 於是頃襄王遣使於諸侯，復為從，欲以伐秦。

translations.literal: Thereupon Qing Xiang Wang sent envoys to the feudal lords, again formed an alliance, desiring to attack Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon King Qing Xiang sent envoys to the feudal lords, again formed an alliance, desiring to attack Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦聞之，發兵來伐楚。

translations.literal: Qin heard it and mobilized troops to come attack Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Qin heard it and mobilized troops to come attack Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚欲與齊韓連和伐秦，因欲圖周。

translations.literal: Chu desired to connect in peace with Qi and Han to attack Qin, therefore desired to plot against Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Chu desired to connect in peace with Qi and Han to attack Qin, therefore desired to plot against Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周王赧使武公謂楚相昭子曰：「三國以兵割周郊地以便輸，而南器以尊楚，臣以為不然。

translations.literal: Zhou wang Nan sent Wu Gong told Chu prime minister Zhao Zi said: 'Three states with troops cut Zhou suburb land to facilitate transport, south vessels to honor Chu, minister think not so.
translations.idiomatic: King Nan of Zhou sent Wu Gong to tell the Chu prime minister Zhao Zi, saying: 'The three states with troops cut Zhou's suburb land to facilitate transport and south vessels to honor Chu. The minister thinks this is not so.

sentences.zh: 夫弒共主，臣世君，大國不親；

translations.literal: Indeed assassinate common lord, minister hereditary lord, great states not close;
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, to assassinate the common lord and minister the hereditary lord, the great states will not be close;

sentences.zh: 以眾脅寡，小國不附。

translations.literal: Coercing the few with the many, small states will not attach.
translations.idiomatic: Coercing the few with the many, small states will not attach.

sentences.zh: 大國不親，小國不附，不可以致名實。

translations.literal: Great states not close, small states not attach, cannot achieve name and substance.
translations.idiomatic: If the great states are not close and the small states do not attach, one cannot achieve name and substance.

sentences.zh: 名實不得，不足以傷民。

translations.literal: Name and substance not obtained, not sufficient to harm the people.
translations.idiomatic: If name and substance are not obtained, it is not sufficient to harm the people.

sentences.zh: 夫有圖周之聲，非所以為號也。」

translations.literal: Indeed having plot Zhou reputation, not what to call banner.'
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, having the reputation of plotting against Zhou is not what to call a banner.'

sentences.zh: 昭子曰：「乃圖周則無之。

translations.literal: Zhao Zi said: 'As for plotting Zhou then none.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Zi said: 'As for plotting against Zhou, there is none.

sentences.zh: 雖然，周何故不可圖也？」

translations.literal: Although, Zhou why cannot plot?'
translations.idiomatic: Although, why cannot Zhou be plotted against?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「軍不五不攻，城不十不圍。

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Army not five not attack, city not ten not surround.
translations.idiomatic: He replied, saying: 'An army not five times larger will not attack, a city not ten times larger will not be surrounded.

sentences.zh: 夫一周為二十晉，公之所知也。

translations.literal: Indeed one Zhou equals twenty Jin states. This is what the duke knows.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, one Zhou equals twenty Jin states. This is what the duke knows.

sentences.zh: 韓嘗以二十萬之眾辱於晉之城下，銳士死，中士傷，而晉不拔。

translations.literal: Han once with two hundred thousand troops was humiliated below Jin's city walls. Sharp soldiers died, middle soldiers were injured, but Jin was not taken.
translations.idiomatic: The state of Han once with two hundred thousand troops was humiliated below Jin's city walls. Sharp soldiers died, middle soldiers were injured, but Jin was not taken.

sentences.zh: 公之無百韓以圖周，此天下之所知也。

translations.literal: The duke has no hundred Han states to plot against Zhou. This is what the world knows.
translations.idiomatic: The duke has no hundred Han states to plot against Zhou. This is what the world knows.

sentences.zh: 夫怨結兩周以塞騶魯之心，交絕於齊，聲失天下，其為事危矣。

translations.literal: Indeed resentment tying the two Zhou states will block Zou and Lu's hearts. Relations cut with Qi, reputation lost in the world. Its affairs will be dangerous.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, resentment tying the two Zhou states will block Zou and Lu's hearts. Relations cut with Qi, reputation lost in the world. Its affairs will be dangerous.

sentences.zh: 夫危兩周以厚三川，方城之外必為韓弱矣。

translations.literal: Indeed endangering the two Zhou states to thicken San Chuan, outside Fang Cheng will certainly become weak for Han.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, endangering the two Zhou states to thicken San Chuan, outside Fang Cheng will certainly become weak for Han.

sentences.zh: 何以知其然也？

translations.literal: How know it so?
translations.idiomatic: How do we know it is so?

sentences.zh: 西周之地，絕長補短，不過百里。

translations.literal: Western Zhou's lands, cutting the long to supplement the short, do not exceed one hundred li.
translations.idiomatic: Western Zhou's lands, cutting the long to supplement the short, do not exceed one hundred li.

sentences.zh: 名為天下共主，裂其地不足以肥國，得其眾不足以勁兵。

translations.literal: Named the world's common lord, splitting its land is not sufficient to enrich the state, obtaining its masses is not sufficient to strengthen the troops.
translations.idiomatic: Named the world's common lord, splitting its land is not sufficient to enrich the state, and obtaining its masses is not sufficient to strengthen the troops.

sentences.zh: 雖無攻之，名為弒君。

translations.literal: Though not attacking it, it is named assassinating the lord.
translations.idiomatic: Though not attacking it, it is named assassinating the lord.

sentences.zh: 然而好事之君，喜攻之臣，發號用兵，未嘗不以周為終始。

translations.literal: However, lords who love good affairs and ministers who love attacking, issuing orders and using troops, never fail to make Zhou the beginning and end.
translations.idiomatic: However, lords who love good affairs and ministers who love attacking, issuing orders and using troops, never fail to make Zhou the beginning and end.

sentences.zh: 是何也？

translations.literal: What this?
translations.idiomatic: What is this?

sentences.zh: 見祭器在焉，欲器之至而忘弒君之亂。

translations.literal: Seeing sacrificial vessels there, desiring the vessels to arrive and forgetting the disorder of assassinating the lord.
translations.idiomatic: Seeing sacrificial vessels there, desiring the vessels to arrive and forgetting the disorder of assassinating the lord.

sentences.zh: 今韓以器之在楚，臣恐天下以器讎楚也。

translations.literal: Now Han because the vessels are in Chu, the minister fears the world will enmity Chu because of the vessels.
translations.idiomatic: Now because the vessels are in Chu, the minister fears the world will make Chu an enemy because of the vessels.

sentences.zh: 臣請譬之。

translations.literal: The minister requests to parable it.
translations.idiomatic: The minister requests to make a parable of it.

sentences.zh: 夫虎肉臊，其兵利身，人猶攻之也。

translations.literal: Indeed tiger meat is rancid, its weapons are sharp and its body strong, yet people still attack it.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, a tiger's meat is rancid, its weapons are sharp and its body strong, yet people still attack it.

sentences.zh: 若使澤中之麋蒙虎之皮，人之攻之必萬於虎矣。

translations.literal: If a deer in the marsh wears tiger skin, people attacking it will certainly be ten thousand times more than attacking a tiger.
translations.idiomatic: If a deer in the marsh wears tiger skin, people attacking it will certainly be ten thousand times more than attacking a tiger.

sentences.zh: 裂楚之地，足以肥國；

translations.literal: Split Chu lands, sufficient enrich state;
translations.idiomatic: Splitting Chu's lands is sufficient to enrich the state;

sentences.zh: 詘楚之名，足以尊主。

translations.literal: Bending Chu's reputation is sufficient to honor the lord.
translations.idiomatic: Bending Chu's reputation is sufficient to honor the lord.

sentences.zh: 今子將以欲誅殘天下之共主，居三代之傳器，吞三翮六翼，以高世主，非貪而何？

translations.literal: Now you will with desire execute harm world common lord, dwell three dynasties transmitted vessels, swallow three pinions six wings, high world lord, not greedy what?
translations.idiomatic: Now you will with desire execute and harm the world's common lord, dwell with the three dynasties' transmitted vessels, swallow three pinions and six wings, to elevate the world's lord. If not greedy, then what?

sentences.zh: 《周書》曰『欲起無先』，故器南則兵至矣。」

translations.literal: 'Zhou Book' says 'desire rise no first', therefore vessels south then troops arrive.'
translations.idiomatic: The 'Zhou Book' says: 'If one desires to rise, there is no first.' Therefore, if the vessels go south, then troops will arrive.'

sentences.zh: 於是楚計輟不行。

translations.literal: Thereupon Chu's plan stopped and was not carried out.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Chu's plan stopped and was not carried out.

sentences.zh: 十九年，秦伐楚，楚軍敗，割上庸、漢北地予秦。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, Qin attacked Chu. The Chu army was defeated and cut Shang Yong and Han Bei lands to give to Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Qin attacked Chu. The Chu army was defeated and cut Shang Yong and Han Bei lands to give to Qin.

sentences.zh: 二十年，秦將白起拔我西陵。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, Qin general Bai Qi took our Xi Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, the Qin general Bai Qi took our Xi Ling.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，秦將白起遂拔我郢，燒先王墓夷陵。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Qin general Bai Qi then took our Ying and burned the former wang's tombs at Yi Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, the Qin general Bai Qi then took our Ying and burned the former king's tombs at Yi Ling.

sentences.zh: 楚襄王兵散，遂不復戰，東北保於陳城。

translations.literal: Chu Xiang Wang's troops scattered. He then no longer fought and defended northeast at Chen city.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang of Chu's troops scattered. He then no longer fought and defended northeast at the city of Chen.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，秦復拔我巫、黔中郡。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Qin again took our Wu and Qian Zhong commanderies.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Qin again took our Wu and Qian Zhong commanderies.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，襄王乃收東地兵，得十餘萬，復西取秦所拔我江旁十五邑以為郡，距秦。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Xiang Wang then gathered troops from the east lands, obtaining more than one hundred thousand. He again took to the west the fifteen cities Qin had taken along our Jiang River to make a commandery and resisted Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, King Xiang then gathered troops from the east lands, obtaining more than one hundred thousand. He again took to the west the fifteen cities Qin had taken along our Jiang River to make a commandery and resisted Qin.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，使三萬人助三晉伐燕。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, he sent thirty thousand people to help the three Jin attack Yan.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, he sent thirty thousand people to help the three Jin attack Yan.

sentences.zh: 復與秦平，而入太子為質於秦。

translations.literal: He again made peace with Qin and entered the crown prince as hostage in Qin.
translations.idiomatic: He again made peace with Qin and entered the crown prince as hostage in Qin.

sentences.zh: 楚使左徒侍太子於秦。

translations.literal: Chu sent the left follower to attend the crown prince in Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Chu sent the left follower to attend the crown prince in Qin.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，頃襄王病，太子亡歸。

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, Qing Xiang Wang fell ill. The crown prince fled back.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, King Qing Xiang fell ill. The crown prince fled back.

sentences.zh: 秋，頃襄王卒，太子熊元代立，是為考烈王。

translations.literal: In autumn, Qing Xiang Wang died. Crown prince Xiong Yuan replaced him and ascended, becoming Kao Lie Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, King Qing Xiang died. The crown prince Xiong Yuan replaced him and ascended, becoming King Kao Lie.

sentences.zh: 考烈王以左徒為令尹，封以吳，號春申君。

translations.literal: Kao Lie Wang made the left follower Ling Yin, enfeoffed him with Wu, and named him Chun Shen Jun.
translations.idiomatic: King Kao Lie made the left follower Ling Yin, enfeoffed him with Wu, and named him Chun Shen Jun.

sentences.zh: 考烈王元年，納州于秦以平。

translations.literal: In Kao Lie Wang's first year, he gave Zhou to Qin to make peace.
translations.idiomatic: In King Kao Lie's first year, he gave Zhou to Qin to make peace.

sentences.zh: 是時楚益弱。

translations.literal: At this time Chu grew increasingly weak.
translations.idiomatic: At this time Chu grew increasingly weak.

sentences.zh: 六年，秦圍邯鄲，趙告急楚，楚遣將軍景陽救趙。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Qin surrounded Han Dan. Zhao urgently informed Chu. Chu sent general Jing Yang to save Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Qin surrounded Han Dan. Zhao urgently informed Chu. Chu sent general Jing Yang to save Zhao.

sentences.zh: 七年，至新中。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, he arrived at Xin Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, he arrived at Xin Zhong.

sentences.zh: 秦兵去。

translations.literal: The Qin troops departed.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin troops departed.

sentences.zh: 十二年，秦昭王卒，楚王使春申君弔祠于秦。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Qin Zhao Wang died. The Chu wang sent Chun Shen Jun to offer condolences and sacrifices in Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, King Zhao of Qin died. The Chu king sent Chun Shen Jun to offer condolences and sacrifices in Qin.

sentences.zh: 十六年，秦莊襄王卒，秦王趙政立。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Qin Zhuang Xiang Wang died. Qin wang Zhao Zheng was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, King Zhuang Xiang of Qin died. The Qin king Zhao Zheng was established.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，與諸侯共伐秦，不利而去。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, together with the feudal lords he attacked Qin, but it was unfavorable and he departed.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, together with the feudal lords he attacked Qin, but it was unfavorable and he departed.

sentences.zh: 楚東徙都壽春，命曰郢。

translations.literal: Chu moved the capital east to Shou Chun and named it Ying.
translations.idiomatic: Chu moved the capital east to Shou Chun and named it Ying.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，考烈王卒，子幽王悍立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Kao Lie Wang died. His son You Wang Han was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, King Kao Lie died. His son King You Han was established.

sentences.zh: 李園殺春申君。

translations.literal: Li Yuan killed Chun Shen Jun.
translations.idiomatic: Li Yuan killed Chun Shen Jun.

sentences.zh: 幽王三年，秦、魏伐楚。

translations.literal: In You Wang's third year, Qin and Wei attacked Chu.
translations.idiomatic: In King You's third year, Qin and Wei attacked Chu.

sentences.zh: 秦相呂不韋卒。

translations.literal: Qin prime minister Lu Bu Wei died.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin prime minister Lu Bu Wei died.

sentences.zh: 九年，秦滅韓。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Qin extinguished Han.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Qin extinguished Han.

sentences.zh: 十年，幽王卒，同母弟猶代立，是為哀王。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, You Wang died. His same-mother younger brother You replaced him and was established, becoming Ai Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, King You died. His same-mother younger brother You replaced him and was established, becoming King Ai.

sentences.zh: 哀王立二月餘，哀王庶兄負芻之徒襲殺哀王而立負芻為王。

translations.literal: Ai Wang was established for more than two months. Ai Wang's concubine elder brother Fu Chu's followers raided and killed Ai Wang, establishing Fu Chu as wang.
translations.idiomatic: King Ai was established for more than two months. King Ai's concubine elder brother Fu Chu's followers raided and killed King Ai, establishing Fu Chu as the king.

sentences.zh: 是歲，秦虜趙王遷。

translations.literal: This year, Qin captured Zhao wang Qian.
translations.idiomatic: This year, Qin captured King Qian of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 王負芻元年，燕太子丹使荊軻刺秦王。

translations.literal: In wang Fu Chu's first year, Yan crown prince Dan sent Jing Ke to assassinate the Qin wang.
translations.idiomatic: In King Fu Chu's first year, the Yan crown prince Dan sent Jing Ke to assassinate the Qin king.

sentences.zh: 二年，秦使將軍伐楚，大破楚軍，亡十餘城。

translations.literal: In the second year, Qin sent a general to attack Chu. He greatly broke the Chu army and lost more than ten cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Qin sent a general to attack Chu. He greatly broke the Chu army and lost more than ten cities.

sentences.zh: 三年，秦滅魏。

translations.literal: In the third year, Qin extinguished Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Qin extinguished Wei.

sentences.zh: 四年，秦將王翦破我軍於蘄，而殺將軍項燕。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Qin general Wang Jian broke our army at Qi and killed general Xiang Yan.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, the Qin general Wang Jian broke our army at Qi and killed general Xiang Yan.

sentences.zh: 五年，秦將王翦、蒙武遂破楚國，虜楚王負芻，滅楚名為［楚］郡云。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Qin generals Wang Jian, Meng Wu then broke Chu state, captured Chu wang Fu Chu, extinguished Chu named [Chu] commandery.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, the Qin generals Wang Jian and Meng Wu then broke the Chu state, captured King Fu Chu of Chu, extinguished Chu, and named it the [Chu] commandery.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：楚靈王方會諸侯於申，誅齊慶封，作章華臺，求周九鼎之時，志小天下；

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Chu Ling Wang just assembled feudal lords at Shen, executed Qi Qing Feng, built Zhang Hua Tai, sought Zhou nine tripods time, ambitions small world;
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: When King Ling of Chu just assembled the feudal lords at Shen, executed Qing Feng of Qi, built Zhang Hua Tai, and sought the Zhou nine tripods, his ambitions were small to the world;

sentences.zh: 及餓死于申亥之家，為天下笑。

translations.literal: He reached the point of starving to death at Shen Hai's home and became the world's laughingstock.
translations.idiomatic: He reached the point of starving to death at Shen Hai's home and became the world's laughingstock.

sentences.zh: 操行之不得，悲夫！

translations.literal: Conduct conduct not obtained, sorrowful!
translations.idiomatic: Conduct was not obtained. How sorrowful!

sentences.zh: 勢之於人也，可不慎與？

translations.literal: Power to people, can not careful?
translations.idiomatic: Power to people, can one not be careful?
